glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pot.objectname_bg: потенциално излагане на хора на замърсяване (на вредно облъчване)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pot.objecttrans_bg: потенциално излагане на хора на замърсяване (на вредно облъчване)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pot.definition: The exposure of people if they are in ambient air 24 hours a day. [definition source: EEA. 2000. Are we moving in the right direction. Indicators on transport and environment integration in the EU. TERM 2000. Copenhagen. Page 27. Environmental issues series No 12]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.name: economic policy instruments
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.definition: Policy instruments which create the economic incentives for individuals to choose freely to modify or reduce their activities, thus indirectly producing an environmental improvement. [definition source: Scialabba. 1998. Quoted by: FAO.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cha.definition: Synonyms: CCI RF [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cha.name: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Russian Federation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cha.objecttrans_en: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Russian Federation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cha.objectname_en: chamber of commerce and industry of the russian federation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.definition: The conservation of components of biological diversity outside their natural habitats. [definition source: Convention on Biological Diversity (art.2).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.name: off-site conservation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_Glo.definition: Synonyms: GIWA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_Glo.name: Global International Waters Assessments

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_BaP.definition: Synonyms: benzo(a)pyrene [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_BaP.name: BaP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_in-.name: in-built evaluation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_in-.definition: A framework in which the evaluation procedure is tied up with the design, implementation and adaptation of policy instruments. [definition source: OECD. 1977. Evaluating economic instruments for enviromental policy,]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ASE.definition: Synonyms: Asia-Europe Foundation [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ASE.name: ASEF

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sus.definition: Sustainable development indicators are indicators that measure progress made in sustainable growth and development. They can provide an early warning, sounding the alarm in time to prevent economic, social and environmental damage. They are also important tools to communicate ideas of sustainable development. Indicators for monitoring progress towards sustainable development are needed in order to assist decision-makers and policy-makers at all levels and to increase focus on sustainable development. Beyond the commonly used economic indicators of well-being, however, social, environmental and institutional indicators have to be taken into account as well to arrive at a broader, more complete picture of societal development. A core set of 58 indicators and methodology sheets are now available for all countries to use. This core set was adopted by the Commission on Sustainable Development (CSD) at its Third Session in April 1995. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sus.name: sustainability indicator

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.definition: Method of evaluating the probability of the adverse effects of a substance, industrial process, technology or natural process. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.name: risk analysis

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.objectname_hu: {wat} emissziónorma; {aircha} kibocsátási határérték; {gen} kibocsátási határérték, emissziónorma
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.name: emission standard
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.objecttrans_hu: {WAT} emissziónorma; {AIRCHA} kibocsátási határérték; {GEN} kibocsátási határérték, emissziónorma
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.objectname_bg: стандарти и норми за емисии, допустими за единичен източник на вредни вещества
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.objecttrans_bg: стандарти и норми за емисии, допустими за единичен източник на вредни вещества
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.definition: The maximum amount of discharge legally allowed from a single source, mobile or stationary. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: Domestic electricity production, plus imports, minus exports. [definition source: EEA. 2001. Renewable energies: success stories. Copenhagen.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: gross electricity consumption

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_slu.name: sludge
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_slu.definition: 1) A semifluid mass of sediment resulting from treatment of water, sewage and/or other wastes. 2) A soft, soupy, or muddy bottom deposit, such as found on tideland or at the bottom of a water body. [definition source: 1) EEA. 2) EEA (GEMET).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ele.definition: The act or process of transforming other forms of energy into electric energy. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ele.name: electricity generation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_atm.definition: Atmospheric processes are distinguished in physical and chemical processes and both types may be operating simultaneously in complicated and interdependent ways. The physical processes of transport by atmospheric winds and the formation of clouds and precipitation strongly influence the patterns and rates of acidic deposition, while chemical reactions govern the forms of the compounds deposited. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_atm.name: atmospheric process

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CEM.definition: Synonyms: Council of European Municipalities and Regions [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CEM.name: CEMR

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cos.name: cost recovery
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cos.definition: The ratio of payments over expenditure. [definition source: NEI Transport. 2000. Phare Multi-Country Transport Programme (ZZ-9610) Road transport charges. Final report.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sto.definition: An atmospheric disturbance involving perturbations of the prevailing pressure and wind fields on scales ranging from tornadoes to extratropical cyclones; also the associated weather and the like. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sto.name: storm

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IFC.definition: Synonyms: Intergovernmental Forum on Chemical Safety [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IFC.name: IFCS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mic.definition: Microscopically small plants which float or swim weakly in fresh or salt water bodies. [definition source: Irelands Environment.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mic.name: microalgae

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.objectname_lv: eiropas ķīmiskās rūpniecības padomes (cefic) izvirzītā programma 'rūpes un atbildība'
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.objectname_de: responsible care, name of the programme in germany: 'responsible care  verantwortliches handeln im chemiehandel'
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.objecttrans_de: Responsible Care, Name of the programme in Germany: 'Responsible Care  Verantwortliches Handeln im Chemiehandel'
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.name: Responsible Care
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.objecttrans_lv: Eiropas Ķīmiskās rūpniecības padomes (CEFIC) izvirzītā programma 'Rūpes un atbildība'
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.objectname_bg: програма 'отговорно отношение' на ес в химическата промишленост
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.objecttrans_bg: програма 'Отговорно отношение' на ЕС в химическата промишленост
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Res.definition: The 'Responsible Care' programme, promoted by the European Chemical Industry Council (CEFIC, 1996), has been adopted in 21 European countries. This programme encourages the cross-fertilisation of ideas and best practices. The programme, based on the original Canadian initiative, is designed to improve the chemical industry's health, safety, environmental and quality performance, as well as communications with the public concerning products and plant operations. [definition source: EEA. Chemicals in the European Environment: Low Doses, High Stakes? - The EEA and UNEP Annual Message 2 on the State of Europe's Environment.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_org.definition: Organic fertilisers mean materials of animal origin used to maintain or improve plant nutrition and the physical and chemical properties and biological activity of soils, either separately or together, they may include manure, digestive tract content, compost and digestion residues. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_org.name: organic fertiliser

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: The International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES) is the oldest intergovernmental organisation in the world concerned with marine and fisheries science. The council was first established in Copenhagen in 1902, but now operates under the terms of the 1964 Convention for the International Council for the Exploration of the Sea. Since its establishment in 1902, ICES has been a leading scientific forum for the exchange of information and ideas on the sea and its living resources, and for the promotion and coordination of marine research by scientists within its member countries. The area of competence of the council is, broadly speaking, the Atlantic Ocean and its adjacent seas, with an emphasis on the North Atlantic. There is no precise delimitation of this area. [definition source: Internet guide to international fisheries law.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_en: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objectname_en: international council for the exploration of the sea

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_for.definition: The practical application of biological, physical, quantitative, managerial, economic, social and policy principles to the regeneration, utilisation, and conservation of forests to meet specified goals and objectives (while maintaining the productivity of the forest). [definition source: IUFRO Silva term database.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_for.name: forest management

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Rap.definition: Synonyms: RASFF [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Rap.name: Rapid Alert Systems for Food and Feed
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Rap.objecttrans_en: Rapid Alert Systems for Food and Feed
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Rap.objectname_en: rapid alert systems for food and feed

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.definition: The state of being poisoned; the condition produced by a poison which may be swallowed, inhaled, injected, or absorbed through the skin. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.name: intoxication

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_low.definition: Lowest concentration or amount of a substance, found by observation or experiment, which causes an adverse effect. [definition source: WHO. 1994. Assessing human health risks of chemicals: Derivation of guidance values for health-based exposure limits. Environmental health criteria 170. World Health Organization, Geneva.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_low.name: lowest-observed-adverse-effect level

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sec.definition: Natural forest growth after some major disturbance (e.g. logging, serious fire, or insect attack). [definition source: European Community Biodiversity Clearing-House Mechanism. Glossary of terms related to the CBD.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sec.name: secondary forest

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_phy.objecttrans_is: plöntusvif, svifjurtir í sjó eða vatni
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_phy.objectname_is: plöntusvif, svifjurtir í sjó eða vatni
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_phy.name: phytoplankton
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_phy.definition: Microscopically small plants which float or swim weakly in fresh or salt water bodies. [definition source: Irelands Environment.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TBT.definition: A very toxic organic compound containing tin. It is used in antifouling paints on vessels and fixed marine structures. [definition source: UNEP. 2001. Protecting the oceans from land-based activities.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TBT.name: TBT

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.name: global warming
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.definition: Changes in the surface-air temperature, referred to as the global temperature, brought about by the greenhouse effect which is induced by emission of greenhouse gases into the air. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nat.definition: Synonyms: RIVM [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nat.name: National Institute for Public Health and the Environment, the Netherlands
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nat.objecttrans_en: National Institute for Public Health and the Environment, the Netherlands
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nat.objectname_en: national institute for public health and the environment, the netherlands

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_pl: substancja zanieczyszczająca powietrze w obszarach zamkniętych
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.name: indoor air pollutants
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_pl: substancja zanieczyszczająca powietrze w obszarach zamkniętych
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_bg: замърсители на въздуха в затворени помещения (пространства)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_ro: poluanţi ai aerului din interiorul clădirilor
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_bg: замърсители на въздуха в затворени помещения (пространства)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.definition: Pollutants that affect air quality in enclosed or confined spaces. [definition source: EEA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_ro: Poluanţi ai aerului din interiorul clădirilor

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_urb.name: urban wastewater
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_urb.definition: (1) The liquid wastes deriving from domestic, commercial and industrial activities of an urban settlement. (2) Urban wastewater means domestic wastewater or the mixture of domestic wastewater with industrial wastewater and/or run-off rain water. [definition source: 1) ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000). 2) Directive 91/271/EEC of 21 May 1991 concerning urban waste-water treatment.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inl.definition: The navigation of inland waterways, i.e. navigable rivers, canals, sounds, lakes, inlets, etc. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inl.name: inland shipping

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.definition: Synonyms: WBCSD [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.name: World Business Council for Sustainable Development
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.objecttrans_en: World Business Council for Sustainable Development
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.objectname_en: world business council for sustainable development

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GFN.definition: Synonyms: Global Footprint Network [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GFN.name: GFN

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.objectname_lv: pārdodamās piesārņojuma vai dabas resursu izmantošanas atļaujas
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.objectname_pl: tytuły do emisji z możliwością odsprzedaży
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.name: tradable permits
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.objecttrans_pl: tytuły do emisji z możliwością odsprzedaży
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.objecttrans_lv: pārdodamās piesārņojuma vai dabas resursu izmantošanas atļaujas
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.definition: An economic policy instrument under which rights to discharge pollution or exploit resources can be exchanged through either a free or a controlled permit-market. Examples include individual transferable quotas in fisheries, tradable depletion rights to mineral concessions and marketable discharge permits for water-borne effluents. [definition source: Scialabba. 1998. Quoted by: FAO:]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_V_VOC.definition: Organic chemical compounds that under normal conditions are gaseous or can vaporise and enter the atmosphere. VOCs include such compounds as methane, benzene, xylene, propane and butane. Methane is primarily emitted from agriculture (from ruminants and cultivation), whereas non-methane VOCs (or NMVOCs) are mainly emitted from transportation, industrial processes and use of organic solvents. See also NMVOC. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_V_VOC.name: VOC

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nat.name: National Reference Centre
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nat.definition: National reference centres (NRCs) are not mentioned in the regulation but have been defined subsequently as a special set of main component elements. National reference centres are also therefore nationally funded institutions/organisations which may be nominated by member countries to play a role in technical coordination within their countries and cooperate with the European topic centre established to cover various topics. [definition source: EEA. G. McInnes. 2001. A brief guide to who does what in the EEA and EIONET. Copenhagen.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CEN.definition: Synonyms: Center for Energy Efficiency [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CEN.name: CENEf

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.definition: Removal of salt, as from water or soil. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.name: water desalination

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.definition: Synonyms: CALM [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.name: Coordination of European Research for Advanced Transport Noise Mitigation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.objecttrans_en: Coordination of European Research for Advanced Transport Noise Mitigation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.objectname_en: coordination of european research for advanced transport noise mitigation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.definition: Directive 90/313/EEC. It requires public authorities to provide the public with access to, and to disseminate, the environmental information they hold. The information must be provided to any natural or legal person at their request, without them having to prove an interest and at the latest within two months for the request being made. [definition source: Environmental Commission. Handbook on the implementation of EC environmental legislation.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.name: Directive on access to environmental information
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.objecttrans_en: Directive on access to environmental information
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.objectname_en: directive on access to environmental information

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.objectname_pl: sprawozdawczość finansowa z uwzględnieniem pełnych kosztów środowiskowych
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.name: full cost accounting
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.objecttrans_pl: sprawozdawczość finansowa z uwzględnieniem pełnych kosztów środowiskowych
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.objectname_fr: méthode du prix de revient complet
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.objectname_bg: счетоводно записване на разходите за научноизследователска дейност като разходи за доставка на материали
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.objecttrans_fr: méthode du prix de revient complet
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.objecttrans_bg: счетоводно записване на разходите за научноизследователска дейност като разходи за доставка на материали
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_ful.definition: A tool to identify, quantify and allocate the direct and indirect environmental costs of ongoing company operations. Full cost accounting helps identify and qualify the following four types of costs for a product, process or project: direct costs, hidden costs, contingent liability costs, and less tangible costs. [definition source: GEMI. 1994. Quoted by: International Institute for Industrial Development Economics at Lund University. 2000. Continuity, credibility and comparability. Sweden.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IOM.definition: Synonyms: Inter-Organization Programme for the Sound Management of Chemicals [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IOM.name: IOMC

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pub.objectname_de: sensibilisierung der öffentlichkeit, bewusstsein der öffentlichkeit
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pub.objecttrans_de: Sensibilisierung der Öffentlichkeit, Bewusstsein der Öffentlichkeit
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pub.name: public awareness
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pub.objectname_bg: съзнателно отношение на обществото към околната среда, обществено екосъзнание
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pub.objecttrans_bg: съзнателно отношение на обществото към околната среда, обществено екосъзнание

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.definition: Animals and plants that grow independently of people, usually in natural conditions. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.name: wildlife

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_STA.objecttrans_el: βάση δεδομένων STAR (βιωσιμότητα, στόχοι και τιμές αναφοράς)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_STA.objectname_lv: star datu bāze, vides politikas mērķu un vides noturības uzziņu datu bāze
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_STA.objectname_da: star-database (indeholder miljøpolitiske mål og referenceværdier for bæredygtighed)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_STA.objecttrans_da: STAR-database (indeholder miljøpolitiske mål og referenceværdier for bæredygtighed)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_STA.definition: Sustainability targets and reference (STAR) database. An inventory of current environmental policy targets and sustainability reference values (SRVs) which apply in the EEA member countries. [definition source: EEA]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_amb.name: ambient air
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_amb.definition: The air occurring at a particular time and place outside of structures. Often used interchangeably with 'outdoor air'. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_slu.name: sludge digestion
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_slu.definition: Final biochemical reduction stage in sewage treatment in which organic matter is broken down and stabilised by bacteria and other micro-organisms. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: ECNC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Centre for Nature Conservation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.definition: Synonyms: ERUs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.name: emission reduction units

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lon.definition: Synonyms: LTAA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lon.name: long-term annual average

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pol.definition: Synonyms: PRTR [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pol.name: Pollutant Release and Transfer Register

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Com.name: common agricultural policy
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Com.objectname_bg: обща селскостопанска политика, селскостопанска политика на общността
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Com.objecttrans_bg: обща селскостопанска политика, селскостопанска политика на Общността
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Com.definition: The set of policy principles, regulations and subsidy mechanisms adopted by the Member States of the European Community that consolidates efforts in promoting or ensuring reasonable pricing of food products, fair standards of living for farmers, stable agricultural markets, increased farm productivity and methods for dealing with food supply or surplus. [definition source: Adapted from: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_unc.definition: Arable land not under rotation that is set at rest for a period of time ranging from one to five years before it is cultivated again, or land usually under permanent crops, meadows or pastures, which is not being used for that purpose for a period of at least one year. Arable land which is normally used for the cultivation of temporary crops but which is temporarily used for grazing is included. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_unc.name: uncultivated land

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lar.definition: Synonyms: LCP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lar.name: large combustion plant

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hyd.definition: Power station which operates with the free renewable source of energy provided by falling water. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hyd.name: hydroelectric power plant

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bro.definition: Land within the urban area on which development has previously taken place. [definition source: Borough Council (UK).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bro.name: brownfield site

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lif.definition: A scientific technique for assessing the potential environmental impacts of industrial systems and their associated products. This technique is 'cradle-to-grave' in scope, meaning that it considers impacts at each stage of a product's life-cycle, from the time natural resources are extracted from the ground and processed through each subsequent stage of manufacturing, transportation, product use, and ultimately, disposal. [definition source: SCS (Scientific Certification System).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lif.name: life cycle impact assessment

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CIS.definition: Synonyms: Commonwealth of Independent States [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CIS.name: CIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_suf.definition: Synonyms: SI [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_suf.name: sufficiency index

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IOMC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: Inter-Organization Programme for the Sound Management of Chemicals
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_en: Inter-Organization Programme for the Sound Management of Chemicals
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objectname_en: inter-organization programme for the sound management of chemicals

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CEP.name: CEPI

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_out.name: outfall
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_out.objectname_bg: място за изхвърляне на отпадъчни води
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_out.objecttrans_bg: място за изхвърляне на отпадъчни води
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_out.definition: Point of discharge of wastewater. [definition source: The Global Development Research Centre.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.name: deposit-refund system
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.objectname_ro: sistem de despăgubire pe baza unui fond
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.definition: Surcharge on the price of potentially polluting products. When pollution is avoided by returning the products or their residuals, a refund of the surcharge is granted. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.objecttrans_ro: sistem de despăgubire pe baza unui fond

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EU-.definition: The 10 countries that joined the EU in 2004: Cyprus, the Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Slovakia and Slovenia. Joined the European Union on 1 May 2004 [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EU-.name: EU-10

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: EPRTR [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Pollutants Release and Transfer Register
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_en: European Pollutants Release and Transfer Register
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_en: european pollutants release and transfer register

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SOE.definition: According to Aarhus Convention the state of the environment report represents comprehensive publication (in printed or electronic forms), which provides information about the state of elements of the environment, such as air and atmosphere, water, soil, land, landscape and natural sites, biological diversity and its components, including genetically modified organisms, and the interaction among these elements; about the factors, such as substances, energy, noise and radiation, and activities or measures, including administrative measures, environmental agreements, policies, legislation, plans and programmes, affecting or likely to affect the elements of the environment, and cost-benefit and other economic analyses and assumptions used in environmental decision-making and the information about the state of human health and safety, conditions of human life, cultural sites and built structures, in as much as they are or may be affected by the state of the elements of the environment or, through these elements, by the factors, activities or measures referred above. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SOE.name: SOER report

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ERT.definition: The Landsat program is the longest running enterprise for acqusition of imagery of Earth from space. The first Landsat satellite was launched in 1972; the most recent, Landsat 7, was launched on April 15, 1999. The instruments on the Landsat satellites have acquired millions of images. The images, archived in the United States and at Landsat receiving stations around the world, are a unique resource for global change research and applications in agriculture, geology, forestry, regional planning, education and national security. History: The program was called the Earth Resources Observation Satellites Program when it was initiated in 1966, but the name was changed to Landsat in 1975.Landsat 1 - launched July 23, 1972, terminated operations in 1978, Landsat 2 - launched January 22, 1975, terminated in 1981, Landsat 3 - launched March 5, 1978, terminated 1983, Landsat 4 - launched July 16, 1982, terminated 1993, Landsat 5 - launched March 1, 1984, Landsat 6 - launched October 5, 1993, failed to reach orbit, Landsat 7 - launched April 15, 1999. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ERT.name: ERTS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.definition: The branch of science studying the interactions among living things and their environment. [definition source: IMO/UNESCO/WMO/WHO/IAEA/UN/UNEP. Joint Group of experts of the scientific aspects of marine environmental protection. Protecting the oceans from land-based activities.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.name: ecology

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: Ground control points (GCPs) are used in remapping satellite or aerosurvey imagery to standard map projections. Each point is identified both on image and map and after that it has precise geographical location and height. Location could be based on topography map, GPS measurements or geodetic measurements. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: ground control point

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UWW.definition: Council Directive 91/271/EEC of 21 May 1991 concerning urban wastewater treatment. This directive concerns the collection, treatment and discharge of urban wastewater and the treatment and discharge of wastewater from certain industrial sectors. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UWW.name: UWWT

In 1996, the Council of Europe, the European Environment Agency (EEA) and the World Conservation Monitoring Centre (WCMC) integrated their respective databases and established a single common database of designated areas in Europe, together with the mechanism to maintain it. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_COR.definition: Coordination of information on the environment. A programme proposed in 1985 by the European Commission, aimed at gathering information relating to the environment on certain priority topics for the European Union (land cover, coastal erosion, biotopes, etc.). [definition source: European Commission.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.name: land-use planning
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.definition: The systematic assessment of land and water potential, alternative patterns of land use and other physical, social and economic conditions, for the purpose of selecting and adopting land-use options which are most beneficial to land users without degrading the resources or the environment, together with the selection of measures most likely to encourage such land uses. Land-use planning may be at international, national, district (project, catchment) or local (village) levels. It includes participation by land users, planners and decision-makers and covers educational, legal, fiscal and financial measures. [definition source: FAO. 1993.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: ICLEI [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Council for Local Environmental Initiatives
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_en: International Council for Local Environmental Initiatives
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objectname_en: international council for local environmental initiatives

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nit.definition: Gas formed by combustion under high pressure and high temperature in an internal combustion engine. It changes into nitrogen dioxide in the ambient air and contributes to photochemical smog. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nit.name: nitric oxide

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_chl.definition: A green pigment, present in algae and higher plants, that absorbs light energy and thus plays a vital role in photosynthesis. Except in Cyanophyta (blue-green algae), chlorophyll is confined to chloroplasts. There are several types of chlorophyll, but all contain magnesium and iron. Some plants (e.g., brown algae, red algae, copper beech trees) contain additional pigments that mask the green of their chlorophyll. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_chl.name: chlorophyl "a"

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ann.definition: Any of the groups of segmented worms (earthworms, ragworms, leeches). Annelids are characterized by a long, soft body and cylindrical or somewhat flattened cross-section. [definition source: School of aquatic and fishery sciences of Washington.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ann.name: annelid

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_bg: Европейска мрежа за наблюдение планирането на пространството
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: At the Tampere informal meeting of the Ministers with responsibility for regional planning, a decision was taken to set up the European Spatial Planning Observatory Network (ESPON) as one of the 12 measures for implementing the European spatial development perspective. The aim of the observatory is to provide the necessary database to encourage the harmonious development of the entire Community and to clarify the concept of territorial cohesion. ESPON activities rely on networking between the Member States (research institutes, public authorities). [definition source: European Commission.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_cs: evropská pozorovací síť pro územní plánování
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_ro: reţeaua de monitorizare a planificării teritoriului european
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_nl: Waarnemingspost voor de ruimtelijke ordening van het europees grondgebied
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_no: Det europeiske nettet for observasjon av romlig planlegging

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TAC.definition: Synonyms: EU assistance programme Technical Assistance to the Commonwealth of Independent States [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TAC.name: TACIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cri.name: critical load
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cri.objectname_bg: критично въздействие (върху околната среда без сериозно увреждане)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cri.objecttrans_bg: критично въздействие (върху околната среда без сериозно увреждане)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cri.definition: (1) Carrying capacity is the ability of eco-systems/the earth to bear environmental load without significant damage. The threshold is the critical load. (2) The maximum load that a given system can tolerate before failing. [definition source: 1) EEA. 1999. Making sustainability accountable: Eco-efficiency, resource productivity and innovation. Topic report No 11/1999. 2) ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tol.definition: Ability of an organism to endure unfavourable environmental conditions. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tol.name: tolerance

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GCP.definition: Ground control points (GCPs) are used in remapping satellite or aerosurvey imagery to standard map projections. Each point is identified both on image and map and after that it has precise geographical location and height. Location could be based on topography map, GPS measurements or geodetic measurements. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GCP.name: GCP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: The total output of goods and services produced by a national economy in a given period, usually a year, valued at market prices. It is gross, since no allowance is made for the value of replacement of capital goods. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: gross domestic product

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_flu.name: flue gas desulphurisation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_flu.definition: A technology that employs a sorbent, usually lime or limestone, to remove sulfur dioxide from the gases produced by burning fossil fuels. Flue gas desulfurisation is current state-of-the art technology for major SO2 emitters, like power plants. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.definition: Synonyms: GPA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.name: global programme of action

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CVD.definition: CVD is the name for the group of disorders of the heart and blood vessels and include: - Hypertension (high blood pressure) - Coronary heart disease (heart attack) - Cerebrovascular disease (stroke) - Peripheral vascular disease - Heart failure - Rheumatic heart disease - Congenital heart disease - Cardiomyopathies [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CVD.name: CVD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sor.name: sorption
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sor.objectname_bg: сорбция (обратимо съединяване на вещество в разменяема форма на съставни части от почвата)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sor.objecttrans_bg: сорбция (обратимо съединяване на вещество в разменяема форма на съставни части от почвата)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sor.definition: The action of soaking up or attracting substances; process used in many pollution control systems. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ROD.definition: Database holding information on EEA member countries' different obligations to international and EU organisations with regard to environmental reporting that follows from both international and EU legislation and other international and EU cooperation. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ROD.name: ROD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ECH.definition: Synonyms: European Commission Humanitarian Aid Office [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ECH.name: ECHO

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.name: carcinogenicity
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.objectname_nl: carcinogeniteit; het kankerverwekkend zijn; kankerverwekkend vermogen
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.definition: The ability or tendency of a substance or physical agent to cause or produce cancer. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.objecttrans_nl: carcinogeniteit; het kankerverwekkend zijn; kankerverwekkend vermogen

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.name: integrated crop management
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.objectname_fi: yhdennetty maanviljely, maanviljely, jossa ympäristöasiat otetaan huomioon taloudellisten seikkojen ohella
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.objecttrans_fi: yhdennetty maanviljely, maanviljely, jossa ympäristöasiat otetaan huomioon taloudellisten seikkojen ohella
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.definition: An approach to farming which aims to balance production with economic and environmental considerations by means of a combination of measures including crop rotation, cultivations, appropriate crop varieties and careful use of inputs. [definition source: English Nature. 1996. Glossary of Agri-Environmental Terms. Research Reports No. 159. Mitchell, K. and Baldock, D. ISSN 0967-876X.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bac.name: background level
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bac.objectname_bg: стойност (ниво) на естественото натоварване (увреждане) на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bac.objecttrans_bg: стойност (ниво) на естественото натоварване (увреждане) на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bac.definition: (1) The concentration of a substance in an environmental medium (air, water, or soil) that occurs naturally or is not the result of human activities. (2) In exposure assessment, the concentration of a substance in a defined control area, during a fixed period of time before, during, or after a data-gathering operation. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hea.definition: One of the main habitat types in the EUNIS habitats classification. Non-coastal habitats which are dry or only seasonally wet (with the water table at or above ground level for less than half of the year) with greater than 30 % vegetation cover. The dominant vegetation is shrubs or dwarf shrubs. Includes regularly tilled shrub orchards, hedges (which may have occasional tall trees) and habitats characterised by the presence of permafrost. Also includes dwarf trees and scrub (under 50 cm, such as occur in extreme alpine conditions). [definition source: Davies, C. E. and Moss, D. 1999. Quoted by: EUNIS. EUNIS habitats classification. Glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hea.objecttrans_ro: habitate de bărăgane, arbuşti şi tundră
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hea.objecttrans_no: habitater i lynghei, krattskog og tundra

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IPI.name: IPIECA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppm.definition: The number of 'parts' by weight of a substance per million parts of water. This unit is commonly used to represent pollutant concentrations. [definition source: US Geological Survey. United States.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppm.name: ppm

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tou.name: tourism satellite accounts
