glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MoU.definition: An agreement of cooperation between organisations defining the roles and responsibilities of each organisation in relation to the other or others with respects to an issue over which the organisations have concurrent jurisdiction. The EEA has a memorandum of understanding with several bodies to secure efficient cooperation. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MoU.name: MOU

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mac.definition: Benthic organisms (animals or plants) whose shortest dimension is greater than or equal to 0.5 mm. [definition source: State University of New York at Stony Brook. Glossary on marine biology.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mac.name: macrobenthos

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cle.definition: Commission communication of 4 May 2001 The clean air for Europe (CAFE) programme: towards a thematic strategy for air quality'. CAFE is the first of the thematic strategies announced in the Sixth environmental action programme . [definition source: European Commission.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cle.name: clean air for Europe programme

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_DDE.definition: Synonyms: dichlorodiphenyl dichloroethylene [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_DDE.name: DDE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.definition: Synonyms: euro [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.name: EUR

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GRI.definition: DEWA~Europe/GRID-Geneva is one of UNEP's major centres for data and information management, with a unique, 'value-adding' mandate in the handling of global and regional environmental data, which in turn support the environment assessment and early-warning activities of UNEP and its partners. At the same time, DEWA~Europe occupies the niche of francophone centre for the global GRID network. DEWA~Europe/GRID-Geneva is supported by a 'Partnership Agreement' between UNEP, the Swiss Agency for Environment, Forests and Landscape (SAEFL) and the University of Geneva. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GRI.name: GRID United Nations Environment Programme/Global Resources Information Database
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GRI.objecttrans_en: GRID United Nations Environment Programme/Global Resources Information Database
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GRI.objectname_en: grid united nations environment programme/global resources information database

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eff.definition: Measurement of radioactivity that expresses the variety of dose equivalents for different organs of the body as a single number. It is commonly referred to as a 'dose', and is measured in sieverts. It provides an indication of the risk to health from any given exposure to radiation. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eff.name: effective dose equivalent

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GM_.definition: Synonyms: genetically modified crops [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GM_.name: GM crops

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_LTA.definition: Synonyms: long-term annual average [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_LTA.name: LTAA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: ITOPF [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Tanker Owners Pollution Federation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_met.definition: Colourless gas given off by rotting materials. The main constituent of natural gas. [definition source: European Commission. 1999. Caring for our future. Brussels]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_met.name: methane

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_top.definition: Topology is a branch of geometry concerned with the study of topological spaces. (The term topology is also used for a set of open sets used to define topological spaces). Most of the GIS (Geography Information System) layers use simple topology: point, line, polygon and region. Objects of real world are simplified in map by these topological elements e.g. lakes by polygons, roads by lines, wells by points etc. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_top.name: topology

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Ice.definition: Synonyms: EFTA-4 [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Ice.name: Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Switzerland

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: Synonyms: NEAP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: national environmental action plan

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inf.definition: Pathogenic condition resulting from invasion of an host by a pathogen that propagates causing infection. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inf.name: infectious disease

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_COD.definition: The quantity of oxygen used in biological and non-biological oxidation of materials in water; a measure of water quality. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_COD.name: COD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: Eurocontrol [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Organisation for the Safety of Air Navigation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_en: European Organisation for the Safety of Air Navigation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_en: european organisation for the safety of air navigation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_arc.name: arctic (climate zone)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_arc.definition: Of or pertaining to the North Pole, or the North Polar regions. Characterised by or typical of the very cold climate of the polar region. [definition source: New shorter Oxford English dictionary. Quoted by: EUNIS. EUNIS habitats classification. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pre.definition: This is the estimated concentration of a chemical in an environmental compartment calculated from available information on its properties, its use and discharge patterns, and the quantities involved. [definition source: Heriot Watt University (UK).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pre.name: predicted environmental concentration

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ara.name: arable land
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ara.definition: Land under temporary crops, temporary meadows for mowing or pasture, land under market and kitchen gardens and land temporarily fallow (less than five years). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dos.definition: Total amount of a substance administered to, taken, or absorbed by an organism. [definition source: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. Risk assessment terminology. Chemistry International Vol. 23, No. 2. March 2001. John H. Duffus.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dos.name: dose

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cas.definition: Synonyms: CEP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cas.name: Caspian Environment Programme

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inl.objecttrans_is: innsævi, vötn, landlukt höf, skipaskurðir, hafnir, flóar og firðir
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inl.objectname_is: innsævi, vötn, landlukt höf, skipaskurðir, hafnir, flóar og firðir
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inl.name: inland water
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inl.definition: All standing or flowing water on the surface of the land, and all groundwater on the landward side of the baseline from which the breadth of territorial waters is measured. [definition source: Directive 2000/60/EC of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (Water Framework Directive).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_WTO.definition: Synonyms: World Trade Organization [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_WTO.name: WTO

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inu.definition: A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from the overflow of inland and/or tidal waters, and/or the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source. A great flow along a watercourse or a flow causing inundation of lands not normally covered by water. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inu.name: inundation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Y_yyr.definition: Synonyms: year [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Y_yyr.name: y/yr

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_HFC.definition: Family of industrial gases included in the basket of six greenhouse gases (GHG) controlled by the Kyoto Protocol. HFCs have replaced ozone-depleting chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) in many applications but are powerful GHGs, with 100-year global warming potential of between 140 and 11 700. [definition source: European Commission. Climate change: Glossary of common terms and acronyms.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_HFC.name: HFC

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fur.definition: Polychlorinated dibenzofurans (PCDFs), often associated with dioxins (PCDDs), are not industrially produced as such but found as impurities in some heavy chlorinated chemicals and as by-products of combustion (from wastes, coal, petroleum products, wood....). [definition source: Euro Chlor. Short glossary of chlorine chemistry.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fur.name: furans

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hex.definition: Synonyms: HCH [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hex.name: hexachlorocyclohexane

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sep.name: separate collection
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sep.definition: The collection of individual components of solid waste from any source, usually separated into different collection containers, in order to recover, reuse or recycle the material or to facilitate its collection and disposal. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CCM.definition: Synonyms: Committee on the Challenges of Modern Society [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CCM.name: CCMS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fis.definition: The part of the fish catch that is put ashore. Frequently, landings provide the only record of total catch; i.e. the landings plus discards. [definition source: Countryside Council for Wales. 2001. A glossary on marine nature conservation and fisheries. United Kingdom.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fis.name: fish landing

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.definition: Synonyms: GEMS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.name: global environment monitoring system

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aci.definition: Any form of precipitation that carries chemicals (mainly sulphur oxides, sulphates, nitrogen oxides and nitrates, and ammonium compounds) that may cause acidification of surface waters, soils and ecosystems. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aci.name: acid precipitation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EU_.definition: Synonyms: EUWI MED [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EU_.name: EU Water Initiative - Mediterranean component

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.definition: Synonyms: WCMC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.name: World Conservation Monitoring Centre

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.definition: Area that has only private houses, not offices and factories. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.name: residential zone

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TRE.definition: policy assessment model to study the effects of different transport and environment policies on the emissions of the transport sector [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TRE.name: TREMOVE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_the.name: thermal power plant
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_the.definition: A power-generating plant which uses heat to produce energy. Such plants may burn fossil fuels or use nuclear energy to produce the necessary thermal energy. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.name: waste generation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.definition: The weight or volume of materials and products that enter the waste stream before recycling, composting, landfilling or combustion takes place. Also can represent the amount of waste generated by a given source or category of sources. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mil.definition: Synonyms: MA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mil.name: Millennium Ecosystem Assessment

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Foo.definition: Synonyms: FAO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Foo.name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Foo.objecttrans_en: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Foo.objectname_en: food and agriculture organization of the united nations

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_org.definition: In March 2000 the European Commission introduced a logo bearing the words 'Organic Farming - EC Control System' [Regulation (EEC) No 2092/91] to be used on a voluntary basis by producers whose systems and products have been found on inspection to satisfy EU regulations. [definition source: European Commission.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_org.name: organic logo

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pes.objectname_hu: {agrare} peszticid, növényvédő szer, rovarirtó / féregirtó szer
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pes.name: pesticide
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pes.objecttrans_hu: {AGRARE} peszticid, növényvédő szer, rovarirtó / féregirtó szer
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pes.definition: Substances or mixture thereof intended for preventing, destroying, repelling, or mitigating any pest. Also, any substance or mixture intended for use as a plant regulator, defoliant, or desiccant. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.definition: Modifications of soil features or, more generally, of its chemical and biological balance, caused by the discharge of polluting substances. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.name: soil pollution

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.definition: Synonyms: GMOs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.name: genetically modified organisms

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.definition: Plants, animals, fungi, and micro-organisms that occur naturally in a given area or region. [definition source: Convention of Biological Diversity Secretariat. Belgian Clearing-House Mechanism.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.name: indigenous species

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Des.definition: The Convention was adopted in Paris on 17 June 1994. It entered into force on 26 December 1996. The objective of this Convention is to combat desertification and mitigate the effects of drought in countries experiencing serious drought and/or desertification, particularly in Africa, through effective action at all levels, supported by international cooperation and partnership arrangements, in the framework of an integrated approach which is consistent with Agenda 21, with a view to contributing to the achievement of sustainable development in affected areas. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Des.name: Desertification convention

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SST.definition: Synonyms: sea surface temperature [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SST.name: SST

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.definition: The process of extracting metallic or nonmetallic mineral deposits from the Earth. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.name: mineral extraction

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SAS.definition: An approach to (environmental) scenario analysis that combines qualitative and quantitative information based on two main elements: a narrative (story) and results from model calculations (simulation). The narrative describes in story-form how relevant events, key driving forces and step-wise changes unfold in the future. The results from model calculations complement the storyline by presenting numerical estimates of environmental indicators. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SAS.name: SAS approach

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.definition: The aim of Directive 94/67/EC on the incineration of hazardous waste is to provide for measures and procedures to prevent or, where that is not practicable, to reduce as fas as possible negative effects on the environment, in particular the pollution of air, soil, surface and groundwater, and the resulting risks to human health, from the incineration of hazardous waste and, to that end, to set up and maintain appropriate operating conditions and emission limit values for hazardous waste incineration plants within the Community. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.name: Directive 94/67/EC on the incineration of hazardous waste
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.objecttrans_en: Directive 94/67/EC on the incineration of hazardous waste
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.objectname_en: directive 94/67/ec on the incineration of hazardous waste

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fir.definition: The state of combustion in which inflammable material burns, producing heat, flames and often smoke. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fir.name: fire

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.definition: Synonyms: POPs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.name: persistent organic pollutants

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.name: gene flow
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.definition: Exchange of genetic traits between populations by movement of individuals, gametes or spores. [definition source: Convention of Biological Diversity Secretariat.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.definition: The lowest part of the atmosphere from the surface to about 10 km in altitude in mid-latitudes (ranging from 9 km in high latitudes to 16 km in the tropics on average) where clouds and 'weather' phenomena occur. In the troposphere, temperatures generally decrease with height. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.name: troposphere

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ero.definition: Practices used during construction or other land disturbing activities to reduce or prevent soil erosion. Typical practices include planting of trees and quick growing grass on disturbed areas and other means to slow the movement of water across a disturbed site and trap the soil that does get transported by runoff. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ero.name: erosion control

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ECP.definition: Synonyms: ecoregional conservation plan [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ECP.name: ECP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acc.objecttrans_it: paesi candidati all'adesione, paesi prossimi all'adesione
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acc.objectname_it: paesi candidati all'adesione, paesi prossimi all'adesione
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acc.name: accession countries
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acc.objectname_bg: желаещи да се присъединят страни, страни в процес на присъединяване
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acc.objecttrans_bg: желаещи да се присъединят страни, страни в процес на присъединяване
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acc.definition: Countries in the process for accession to the European Union. [definition source: European Commission.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tec.name: technological hazard
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tec.definition: Any application of practical or mechanical sciences to industry or commerce capable of harming persons, property or the environment. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_sk: štúdia o vplyvoch na životné prostředie
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental impact study
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_cs: studie o vlivu na životní prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_sk: štúdia o vplyvoch na životné prostředie
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: изследване на въздействието върху околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: изследване на въздействието върху околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Survey conducted to ascertain the conditions of a site prior to the realisation of a project, to analyse its possible impacts and compensative measures. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_cs: studie o vlivu na životní prostředí

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MOS.definition: Synonyms: Modelling opportunities and limits for restructuring Europe towards sustainability [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MOS.name: MOSUS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lin.definition: Lindane is an organochlorine pesticide. It is composed of approximately 99 % HCH. Lindane has been used as a broad-spectrum agricultural insecticide since the early 1950s and is 5-20 times more toxic to insects than DDT. It is also used in ointments to treat head and body lice, and scabies. It is poorly soluble in water and rapid bioaccumulation takes place in microorganisms, invertebrates, fish, birds and humans. However, the elimination of lindane from the body is relatively rapid when exposure is discontinued. Workplace exposure has been reported to cause blood disorders, dizziness, headaches, and changes in the levels of sex hormones. The ingestion of large amounts has caused seizures and death. Liver and kidney effects and immune suppression has been observed at moderate ingestion levels. Lindane is considered to be a carcinogen, and has been associated with liver cancer. [definition source: Adapted from: UNEP-Balkans.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lin.name: lindane

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: EC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Commission

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_KCB.definition: Synonyms: Kyrgyz Community Based Tourism Organisation [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_KCB.name: KCBTA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_POP.definition: Synonyms: persistent organic pollutants [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_POP.name: POPs

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ECB.definition: Synonyms: European Chemicals Bureau [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ECB.name: ECB

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_Tra.definition: Synonyms: THE PEP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_Tra.name: Transport, Health and Environment Pan-European Programme
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_Tra.objecttrans_en: Transport, Health and Environment Pan-European Programme
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_Tra.objectname_en: transport, health and environment pan-european programme

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sol.definition: The energy transmitted from the sun in the form of electromagnetic radiation. The most successful examples of energy extraction from the sun are so far solar cells used in satellites and solar collectors used to heat water. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sol.name: solar power

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bor.name: boreal forest
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bor.definition: The northern hemisphere, circumpolar, tundra forest type consisting primarily of black spruce and white spruce with balsam fir, birch and aspen. [definition source: IUFRO Silva term database.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.name: generalist species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.objectname_nl: generalistische soort, soort die niet of weinig tolerant is t.o.v. milieufactoren (stenoec)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.definition: A species that uses a relatively large proportion, or in extreme cases all, of the available resource types. [definition source: The Encyclopedia of Ecology & Environment Management. Ed. Peter Calow. Blackwell Science Ltd. 1998.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gen.objecttrans_nl: generalistische soort, soort die niet of weinig tolerant is t.o.v. milieufactoren (stenoec)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eva.name: evaluation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eva.definition: (1) Judging something (a scenario, a policy, a strategy, a futures project, etc.) in terms of selected criteria (feasibility, desirability, equity, cost-effectiveness, etc.) or comparing two or more items in terms of such criteria. (2) An investigation as systematic and objective as possible of preparation, implementation and outputs of an on-going or completed project or programme, with a view to investigating the relevance of its objectives, its fulfilment of objectives, efficiency, impact and sustainability. [definition source: 1) WHO.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bur.definition: Controlled process by which solid, liquid, or gaseous combustible wastes are burned and changed into gases; residue produced contains little or no combustible material. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bur.name: burning

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.definition: Any structure, machine, or contrivance, especially a vehicle, designed to be supported by the air, either by the dynamic action of the air upon the surfaces of the structure or object or by its own buoyancy. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.name: aircraft

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PFO.definition: Synonyms: perfluorooctanoic acid [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PFO.name: PFOA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_hu: zárt víztartó réteg, zárt akvifer, artézi víz
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.name: confined aquifer
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objecttrans_hu: zárt víztartó réteg, zárt akvifer, artézi víz
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.definition: Aquifer in which groundwater is confined under pressure significantly greater than atmospheric pressure. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IPCS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Programme on Chemical Safety

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mai.objectname_lv: eionet pamatvienības: nacionālās organizācijas eionet sastāvā
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mai.name: main component elements
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mai.objecttrans_lv: EIONET pamatvienības: nacionālās organizācijas EIONET sastāvā
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mai.objectname_bg: национални служби, посочени от европейската агенция по околната среда за подразделения на еионет
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mai.objecttrans_bg: национални служби, посочени от Европейската агенция по околната среда за подразделения на ЕИОНЕТ
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mai.definition: Main component elements (MCE) are nominated by member countries and are nationally funded institutions/organisations which at the national level are regular collectors and suppliers of environmental data and/or possess relevant knowledge regarding environmental science, monitoring or modelling. [definition source: EEA. G. McInnes. 2001. A brief guide to who does what in the EEA and EIONET. Copenhagen.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mal.definition: Defective nutrition due to inadequate intake of nutrients or to their faulty digestion, assimilation or metabolism. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mal.name: malnutrition

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gre.definition: A plot of vegetated land separating or surrounding areas of intensive residential or industrial use and devoted to recreation or park uses. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gre.name: green space

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mut.definition: Chemical or type of ionising radiation that can cause inheritable changes in the DNA molecules found in the genes of organisms (mutations). [definition source: Okanagan University College.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mut.name: mutagen

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SAU.definition: Synonyms: Sea Around Us Project [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SAU.name: SAUP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PFO.definition: Synonyms: perfluorooctane sulfonic acid [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PFO.name: PFOS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ISO.definition: Synonyms: International Organisation for Standardization [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ISO.name: ISO

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: A procedure based on the development of environmental scenarios, a comparison of scenario results, and an evaluation of their consequences. The goal of environmental scenario analysis is to anticipate future developments of nature and society, and to evaluate strategies for responding to these developments. A key idea is to explore alternative future developments. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental scenario analyses

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objecttrans_it: impianto di trattamento dell'acqua di rifiuto
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objectname_it: impianto di trattamento dell'acqua di rifiuto
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objectname_pt: estação de tratamento de águas residuais (etar)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.name: wastewater treatment plant
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objecttrans_pt: estação de tratamento de águas residuais (ETAR)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objectname_bg: съоръжение за третирае (пречистване, обработка) на отпадъчни води
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objectname_ro: staţie de tratare a apelor reziduale
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objecttrans_bg: съоръжение за третирае (пречистване, обработка) на отпадъчни води
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.definition: (1) Plant where, through physical-chemical and biological processes, organic matter, bacteria, viruses and solids are removed from residential, commercial and industrial wastewaters before they are discharged in rivers, lakes and seas. (2) Installations to render wastewater, sludge, storm water or cooling water fit to meet applicable environmental standards or other quality norms for recycling or reuse. [definition source: 1) ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000). 2) Eurostat/OECD Joint Questionnaire on Environmental Statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.objecttrans_ro: Staţie de tratare a apelor reziduale

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_all.definition: A condition of abnormal sensitivity in certain individuals to contact with substances such as proteins, pollens, bacteria, and certain foods. This contact may result in exaggerated physiologic responses such as hay fever, asthma, and in severe enough situations, anaphylactic shock. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_all.name: allergy

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gui.definition: Value, such as concentration in air or water, that is derived after appropriate allocation of the reference dose among the possible media of exposure to assist regulatory authorities in establishing permissible levels of a potential toxicant. [definition source: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. Risk assessment terminology. Chemistry International Vol. 23, No. 2. March 2001. John H. Duffus.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gui.name: guidance value

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_sk: zastavané, priemyselné a iné umelo vytvorené lokality
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_sl: pozidani, industrijski in drugi umetni habitati

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objecttrans_en: constructed, industrial and other artificial habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_lv: izveidotie, rūpnieciskie un citi mākslīgās biotipi
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_lt: statiniai, pramoninės ir kitos dirbtinės buveinės
