glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dat.name: data service
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dat.objecttrans_lv: Eiropas Vides aģentūras periodisko publikāciju datu bāze
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dat.objecttrans_pt: Data Service (serviço de acesso a dados sobre o ambiente)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dat.objectname_bg: служба за събиране и предоставяне на информация
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dat.objecttrans_bg: Служба за събиране и предоставяне на информация
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dat.definition: The EEA data service provides access to data sets used in EEA periodical reports. The data sets contain aggregated data at national level. They cover at least the 15 EU Member States, but in many cases a pan-European coverage of 52 countries is available. Graphs and, in the future, maps can be generated from the data sets. Information about the source of each data set and its geographical and temporal coverage is attached. [definition source: EEA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_org.definition: The term organochlorine refers to a wide range of chemicals that contain carbon, chlorine and, sometimes, several other elements. A range of organochlorine compounds have been produced including many herbicides, insecticides, fungicides as well as industrial chemicals such as polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs). The compounds are characteristically stable, fat-soluble and bioaccumulate. Organochlorines pose a range of adverse human health risks and some are carcinogens. [definition source: UNEP-Balkans.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_org.name: organochlorines

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.name: biomarker
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.definition: A biological response to a chemical that gives a measure of exposure and, sometimes, of toxic effect. [definition source: European Commission, DG Environment. 1999. Compilation of EU dioxin exposure and health data. Task 7 - Ecotoxicology.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objecttrans_it: direttiva relativa alle discarche di rifiuti
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objectname_pl: dyrektywa o składowaniu odpadķw na wysypiskach
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objectname_it: direttiva relativa alle discarche di rifiuti
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.name: Landfill Directive
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objecttrans_pl: Dyrektywa o składowaniu odpadķw na wysypiskach
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objectname_fr: directive concernant la mise en décharge
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objectname_ro: directiva cu privire la umplerea solului
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objecttrans_fr: directive concernant la mise en décharge
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.definition: Council Directive 1999/31/EC of 26 April 1999 on the landfill of waste. The aim of this directive is, by way of stringent operational and technical requirements on the waste and landfills, to provide for measures, procedures and guidance to prevent or reduce as far as possible negative effects on the environment, in particular the pollution of surface water, groundwater, soil and air, and on the global environment, including the greenhouse effect, as well as any resulting risk to human health, from landfilling of waste, during the whole life-cycle of the landfill. [definition source: Council Directive 1999/31/EC of 26 April 1999 on the landfill of waste (Article 1)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lan.objecttrans_ro: Directiva cu privire la umplerea solului

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNC.definition: Synonyms: United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNC.name: UNCLOS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_API.definition: Synonyms: air pollution index [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_API.name: API

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tol.definition: Toluene is a clear, colourless liquid with a distinctive smell. Toluene occurs naturally in crude oil and in the tolu tree. It is also produced in the process of making gasoline and other fuels from crude oil and making coke from coal. Exposure to toluene occurs from breathing contaminated workplace air, in automobile exhaust, some consumer products paints, paint thinners, fingernail polish, lacquers, and adhesives. Toluene affects the nervous system. [definition source: US Agency for Toxic Substances and Desease Registry.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tol.name: toluene

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IHPA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International HCH and Pesticides Association

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lun.definition: The main function of the lungs is the process of gas exchange called respiration (or breathing). In respiration, oxygen from incoming air enters the blood, and carbon dioxide, a waste gas from the metabolism, leaves the blood. A reduced lung function means that the ability of lungs to exchange gases is reduced. [definition source: EEA Ozone website]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lun.name: lung function

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.name: radiative forcing
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.objectname_bg: мярка за значимостта на потенциален механизъм за промяна на климата
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.objecttrans_bg: мярка за значимостта на потенциален механизъм за промяна на климата
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.definition: A simple measure of the importance of a potential climate change mechanism. Radiative forcing is the perturbation to the energy balance of the earth-atmosphere system following, for example, a change in the concentration of carbon dioxide or a change in the output of the sun; the climate system responds to the radiative forcing so as to re-establish the energy balance. A positive radiative forcing tends to warm the surface and a negative radiative forcing tends to cool the surface. [definition source: Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cru.definition: Invertebrate with a shell and many legs that are used for walking or swimming. Commercial species include: shrimps, prawns, crabs, lobsters and crawfish. A very high proportion of the plankton, particularly that part upon which many pelagic fish species feed, are also Crustacea. [definition source: Countryside Council for Wales. 2001. A glossary on marine nature conservation and fisheries. United Kingdom.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cru.name: crustacean

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hed.name: hedge
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hed.definition: Narrow linear belts of shrubs and trees. [definition source: Adapted from: EUNIS. EUNIS habitats classification. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.definition: Synonyms: DALYs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.name: disability-adjusted life years

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bn.definition: Synonyms: billion [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bn.name: bn

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_for.objectname_hu: az erdő megújulása, az erdő regenerációja
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_for.name: forest regeneration
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_for.objecttrans_hu: az erdő megújulása, az erdő regenerációja
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_for.definition: The natural or artificial process of re-establishing tree cover on forest land. [definition source: IUFRO Silva term database.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_her.name: herbicide
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_her.definition: A chemical that controls or destroys undesirable plants. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PGM.definition: Synonyms: platinum group metals [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PGM.name: PGM

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.name: non-point sources
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.objectname_bg: дифузни източници на замърсяване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.objecttrans_bg: дифузни източници на замърсяване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.definition: Diffuse pollution sources (i.e. without a single point of origin or not introduced into a receiving stream from a specific outlet). Common non-point sources are agriculture, forestry, urban, mining, construction, dams, channels, land disposal, saltwater intrusion and city streets. [definition source: Adapted fom: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ech.definition: Marine animals usually characterised by five-fold symmetry, and possessing an internal skeleton of calcite plates, and a complex water vascular system. Includes echinoids (sea urchins), crinoids (sea lillies) and asteroids (starfish). [definition source: Geological Conservation Review.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ech.name: echinoderm

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.definition: Noise emitted by vehicles (heavy vehicles, cars and motorcycles, tyre/road interaction). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.name: traffic noise

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sol.definition: The energy transmitted from the sun in the form of electromagnetic radiation. The most successful examples of energy extraction from the sun are so far solar cells used in satellites and solar collectors used to heat water. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sol.name: solar energy

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dec.name: decision framework
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dec.objectname_fi: tiedon järjestäminen ja arviointi päätöksentekoa varten
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dec.objectname_nl: raamwerk voor het nemen van besluiten
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dec.objecttrans_fi: tiedon järjestäminen ja arviointi päätöksentekoa varten
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dec.definition: A way of organising and evaluating information. [definition source: Resources for the Future. United States.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dec.objecttrans_nl: raamwerk voor het nemen van besluiten

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SER.definition: The state of the environment reports information system (SERIS) is an Internet-based database of state-of-the-environment reports in European countries. The system provides an overview of state-of-the-environment (SoE) documents (paper reports, internet publications and policy-related products) by country and of key organisations involved in SoE reporting. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SER.name: SERIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_lv: vides pamatsektors, piem., gaiss, ūdens, augsne
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental medium
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_lv: vides pamatsektors, piem., gaiss, ūdens, augsne
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_fi: laaja ympäristön osa, esim. ilma, vesi tai maaperä
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: основни елементи на околната серда (вода, въздух, почва и др.)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_fi: laaja ympäristön osa, esim. Ilma, vesi tai maaperä
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: основни елементи на околната серда (вода, въздух, почва и др.)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Major compartments of the environment, e.g. air, water and soil. [definition source: Environment Protection Agency. 2000. Ireland's environment. A millennium report. Ireland]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: Cefic [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Chemical Industry Council

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dio.definition: The terms 'dioxin' or 'dioxins and furans' generally refers to a group of 210 chlorinated pollutants, chemically known as the polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins and dibenzofurans. Dioxins are organochlorines and are regarded as among the world's most toxic organic pollutants. They are produced as by-products of industrial processes involving chlorine and all types of incineration. Once released into the environment, dioxins are environmentally stable and tend to become associated with sediments or suspended material. Dioxins have the potential to bioaccumulate in the food chain and pose series risks to ecological and human health. [definition source: UNEP Balkans.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dio.name: dioxin

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lag.objectname_lv: laiks starp norisi un tās rezultātu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lag.objectname_da: lag time; forløbet tid mellem en hændelse og effekten af denne hændelse
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lag.objecttrans_da: lag time; forløbet tid mellem en hændelse og effekten af denne hændelse
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lag.name: lag time
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lag.objecttrans_lv: laiks starp norisi un tās rezultātu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lag.definition: The time between the occurrence of a phenomenon and its resulting effect. [definition source: Kemp, David D. 1998. The environment dictionary. Routledge. London.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.name: policy-maker
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.objectname_bg: участник във вземането на политически решения
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.objecttrans_bg: участник във вземането на политически решения
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.definition: Individuals, especially those in official bodies, who have the authority to make decisions about what problems will be addressed within a particular sector and how these problems will be handled. [definition source: WHO.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_FP.definition: Synonyms: framework programme [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_FP.name: FP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_oil.definition: The accidental release of oil, or other petroleum products usually into freshwater or marine ecosystems, and usually in large quantities. It can be controlled by chemical dispersion, combustion, mechanical containment, and absorption. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_oil.name: oil spillage

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.definition: Management of soil to prevent or reduce soil erosion and depletion by wind and water. Preservation of soil against deterioration and loss by using it within its capabilities; application of conservation practices needed for its protection and improvement. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.name: soil conservation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pac.definition: Shall mean the management of waste as defined in Directive 75/442/EEC;(waste means any substance or object which the holder disposes of or is required to dispose of pursuant to the provisions of national law in force). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pac.name: packaging waste management

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_die.name: diesel fuel
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_die.objecttrans_cs: palivo pro dieselové motory, motorová nafta
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_die.definition: Heavy oil residue used as fuel for certain types of diesel engines. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_die.objectname_cs: palivo pro dieselové motory, motorová nafta

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_OEC.definition: Synonyms: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_OEC.name: OECD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.definition: Synonyms: CCS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.name: carbon capture and storage

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.definition: Synonyms: NOBANIS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.name: North European and Baltic Network on Invasive Alien Species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.objecttrans_en: North European and Baltic Network on Invasive Alien Species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.objectname_en: north european and baltic network on invasive alien species

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dom.name: domestic tourism
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dom.definition: In relation to a given country or a region, it is considered a form of tourism, involving residents of the given country travelling only within this country. [definition source: World Tourism Organisation. 1994. Recommendations on Tourism Statistics. United Nations. New York.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exc.definition: The removal of earth from its natural position. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exc.name: excavation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Man.name: Management Board
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Man.definition: The EEA Management Board (MB) is the main decision-making body of the EEA. It consists of 34 members, including one representative from each of the 30 member countries, two from the European Commission and two experts designated by the European Parliament. The MB chairman is elected by the MB members. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_red.name: red list
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_red.objectname_bg: червен списък' (на застрашени от изчезване организми, биологични видове, публикуван от международно сдружение за съхранение на природата и природните ресурси)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_red.objecttrans_bg: Червен списък' (на застрашени от изчезване организми, биологични видове, публикуван от Международно сдружение за съхранение на природата и природните ресурси)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_red.definition: 1) A publication listing the conservation status of different taxa in a given geographic area (e.g. region, country, world). 2) The series of publications produced by the International Union for the Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources (IUCN). They provide an inventory on the threat to rare plants and animal species. Information includes status, geographical distribution, population size, habitat and breeding rate. The books also contain the conservation measures, if any, that have been taken to protect the species. There are five categories of rarity status: endangered species; vulnerable organisms, which are those unlikely to adapt to major environmental effects; rare organisms, which are those at risk because there are few of them in the world, such as plants which only grow on mountain peaks or on islands; out of danger species, which were formerly in the above categories, but have had the threat removed because of conservation actions; and indeterminate species, which are the plants and animals probably at risk, although not enough is known about them to assess their status. [definition source: 1) EEA. 2) EEA (GEMET).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: MARPOL [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Convention for the Prevention of Marine Pollution from Ships
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_en: International Convention for the Prevention of Marine Pollution from Ships
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objectname_en: international convention for the prevention of marine pollution from ships

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.name: energy recovery
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.objecttrans_cs: získávání energie z organické frakce odpadu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.objectname_bg: възстановяване на енергия, енергодобив от отпадъци
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.objecttrans_bg: възстановяване на енергия, енергодобив от отпадъци
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.definition: A form of resource recovery in which the organic fraction of waste is converted to some form of usable energy. Recovery may be achieved through the combustion of processed or raw refuse to produce steam through the pyrolysis of refuse to produce oil or gas; and through the anaerobic digestion of organic wastes to produce methane gas. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.objectname_cs: získávání energie z organické frakce odpadu

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cri.definition: General term referring to the concentration limit beyond which a substance can cause dangerous effects to living organisms. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cri.name: critical level

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_5_5gf.definition: gf [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EIN.definition: A closed list of 100/106 'existing' chemicals governed by Regulation 793/93 on the evaluation and control of the risks of existing substances. [definition source: Adapted from: European Commission. 2001. White paper on strategy for a future chemical policy. COM(2001) 88 final. Brussels.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EIN.name: EINECS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.name: industrial waste
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.definition: Solid, liquid and gaseous wastes originating from the industrial manufacture of products. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EU-.definition: The pre-2007 EU Member States: EU-15 + EU-10 [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EU-.name: EU-25

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.definition: Synonyms: UNSD [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.name: United Nations Statistics Division

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.definition: The study of animals, including their classification, structure, physiology, and history. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.name: zoology

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sur.name: surface water status
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sur.definition: General expression of the status of a body of surface water, determined by the poorer of its ecological status and its chemical status. [definition source: Directive 2000/60/EC of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (Water Framework Directive).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pri.definition: Principle established in the EC Framework Directive on waste. The principle of proximity implies that waste should generally be managed as near as possible to its place of production, mainly because transporting waste has a significant environmental impact. [definition source: Office of the Deputy Prime Minister (UK).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pri.name: principle of proximity

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_ben.definition: Synonyms: BaP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_ben.name: benzo(a)pyrene

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.objecttrans_el: είδος υπό εξαφάνιση / είδος απειλούμενο με εξαφάνιση
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.name: endangered species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.objectname_el: είδος υπό εξαφάνιση / είδος απειλούμενο με εξαφάνιση
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.definition: Taxa in danger of extinction and whose survival is unlikely if the causal factors continue operating. [definition source: Former IUCN Redlist Category]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_buf.objecttrans_is: hlutlaust svæði milli ríkja eða umdæma
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_buf.objectname_is: hlutlaust svæði milli ríkja eða umdæma
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_buf.name: buffer zone
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_buf.definition: The region near the border of a protected area; a transition zone between areas managed for different objectives. [definition source: World Resources Institute. Biodiversity Glossary of Terms.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.name: pollution load
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.objectname_bg: замърсяване на околната среда с вредни вещества, кризисна стойност на замърсяването на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.objecttrans_bg: замърсяване на околната среда с вредни вещества, кризисна стойност на замърсяването на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.definition: The amount of stress placed upon an ecosystem by pollution, physical or chemical, released into it by man-made or natural means. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_HCM.definition: Synonyms: Hellenic Centre for Marine Research [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_HCM.name: HCMR

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objecttrans_is: landeyðing, landrof, að gera land að eyðimörk
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objectname_de: wüstenbildung, desertifikation, ausbreitung von wüsten und steppengebieten, ausbreitung der wüsten, versteppung, ausdehnung der wüstengebiete, verödung
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objecttrans_de: Wüstenbildung, Desertifikation, Ausbreitung von Wüsten und Steppengebieten, Ausbreitung der Wüsten, Versteppung, Ausdehnung der Wüstengebiete, Verödung
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objectname_is: landeyðing, landrof, að gera land að eyðimörk
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.name: desertification
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.definition: Land degradation in arid, semi-arid and dry sub-humid areas resulting from various factors, including climatic variations and human activities. Further, the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) defines land degradation as a reduction or loss in arid, semi-arid and dry sub-humid areas of the biological or economic productivity and complexity of rain-fed cropland, irrigated cropland, or range, pasture, forest, and woodlands resulting from land uses or from a process or combination of processes, including those arising from human activities and habitation patterns, such as: (i) soil erosion caused by wind and/or water; (ii) deterioration of the physical, chemical and biological or economic properties of soil; and (iii) long-term loss of natural vegetation. [definition source: IPCC. Climate Change 2001 Impacts, Adaptation and Vulnerability.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.name: wild species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.definition: Organisms captive or living in the wild that have not been subject to breeding to alter them from their native state. [definition source: World Conservation Monitoring Centre. Glossary of biodiversity terms.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_WG.definition: Synonyms: working group [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_WG.name: WG

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_Ger.definition: Synonyms: German Environmental Survey [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_Ger.name: GerES

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mee.definition: Synonyms: MOP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mee.name: Meeting of the Parties

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.name: water abstraction charge
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.definition: Imposed fee, expense or cost for the abstraction of water. Water abstraction charges can take the form of nominal licence fee linked to an abstraction permit regime or they can vary depending on the quantity used. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_Ger.definition: Synonyms: GerES [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_Ger.name: German Environmental Survey

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ano.name: anoxic
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ano.definition: In aquatic environmental chemistry it refers to water that has become oxygen poor due to the bacterial decay of organic matter. [definition source: Sam Houston State University. United States. Atmospheric Chemistry Glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_chl.definition: Synonyms: CFCs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_chl.name: chlorofluorocarbons

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ano.name: anoxia
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ano.definition: The absence of oxygen. [definition source: UNEP. 2001. Protecting the oceans from land-based activities]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.objectname_de: zustand der umwelt, umweltzustand, umweltlage, umweltsituation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.objecttrans_de: Zustand der Umwelt, Umweltzustand, Umweltlage, Umweltsituation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.name: state of the environment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.objectname_nl: stand van het milieu, toestand van het milieu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.definition: Condition of different environmental compartments and systems. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.objecttrans_nl: stand van het milieu, toestand van het milieu

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IIASA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_en: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objectname_en: international institute for applied systems analysis

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cog.definition: The consecutive generation of useful thermal and electric energy from the same fuel source. [definition source: US EPA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cog.name: cogeneration

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mar.definition: EEA database on aggregated data for the coastline of the Mediterranean, Atlantic, North Sea, Skagerrak, Kattegat and Baltic. Marinebase holds data collected from marine conventions and member countries. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Mar.name: Marinebase

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soc.definition: Social indicators are set of indicators that measure progress towards the policy objectives designed for promoting employment, combating poverty, improving living and working conditions, combating exclusion, developing human resources, etc. Social indicators are also part of Sustainable development indicators as well as the Lisbon strategy. Regarding the Lisbon strategy the role of social indicators is ' to describe the present situation and main challenges for poverty and social exclusion policies in the EU, provide a launched for strengthening policies and programmes across the EU - covering the key aspects of monetary poverty, such as level, persistence, depth, changes through time, as well as the key breakdowns by gender, age, household types and occupation, the multidimensional aspect of poverty in the areas of employment, housing, health and education - areas to which Member States have devoted a particular attention in their National Action Plans against poverty and social exclusion'. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soc.name: social indicator

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sho.definition: The line that separates a land surface from an ocean or sea. [definition source: Okanagan University College.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sho.name: shoreline

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.objectname_hu: {intass} árban nem tartalmazott költségek; {ecorep} árban nem tartalmazott költségek
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.name: external cost
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.objecttrans_hu: {INTASS} árban nem tartalmazott költségek; {ECOREP} árban nem tartalmazott költségek
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.objectname_bg: външни (за потребителя на стока или услуга) разходи, които той не плаща, народностопански разходи
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.objecttrans_bg: външни (за потребителя на стока или услуга) разходи, които той не плаща, народностопански разходи
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.definition: An external cost is a cost not included in the market price of the goods and services being produced, i.e. a cost not borne by those who create it. [definition source: IMO/UNESCO/WMO/WHO/IAEA/UN/UNEP. Joint group of experts of the scientific aspects of marine environmental protection. Protecting the oceans from land-based activities.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.objecttrans_is: náskyld tegund sem lifir villt í náttúrunni
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.objectname_da: vildtlevende beslægtet art; vildtvoksende beslægtet sort
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.objecttrans_da: vildtlevende beslægtet art; vildtvoksende beslægtet sort
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.objectname_is: náskyld tegund sem lifir villt í náttúrunni
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.name: wild relative
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.definition: Plant or animal species that are taxonomically related to crop or livestock species and serve as potential sources for genes in breeding of new varieties of those crops or livestock. [definition source: Convention of Biological Diversity Secretariat. Belgian Clearing-House Mechanism.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.name: ecotoxicity
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.objectname_nl: eco-toxiciteit, milieugiftige eigenschappen, giftigheid voor het milieu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.definition: Quality of some substances or preparations which present or may present immediate or delayed risks for one or more sectors of the environment. [definition source: GEMET 2000]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.objecttrans_nl: eco-toxiciteit, milieugiftige eigenschappen, giftigheid voor het milieu

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IRI.definition: Synonyms: Integrated Regional Information Networks [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IRI.name: IRIN

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: A natural/cultural feature which is of outstanding or unique value because of its inherent rarity, representative of aesthetic qualities or cultural significance. Guidance for selection of a natural monument is: a) The area should contain one or more features of outstanding significance (appropriate natural features include spectacular waterfalls, caves, craters, fossil beds, sand dunes and marine features, along with unique or representative fauna and flora; associated cultural features might include cave dwellings, cliff-top forts, archaeological sites, or natural sites which have heritage significance to indigenous peoples).; b) The area should be large enough to protect the integrity of the feature and its immediately related surroundings. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural monument

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNE.definition: Synonyms: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNE.name: UNESCO

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Six.definition: The sixth environment action programme of the European Community (Environment 2010: our future, our choice) provides the environmental component of the Community's forthcoming strategy for sustainable development for the period 2001-2010. [definition source: European Commission.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Six.name: Sixth environment action programme

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: Violent, sudden and destructive change in the environment without cause from human activity, due to phenomena such as floods, earthquakes, fire and hurricanes. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural disaster

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dat.definition: Process by which data sets are distributed among organisations and users. Information about the source of each data set and its geographical and temporal coverage is attached as metadata. Rules about distribution are written in data sharing protocols, copyrights or relevant contracts. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dat.name: data dissemination

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.definition: A violent, sudden release of energy resulting from powders or gases undergoing instantaneous ignition or from some other means of detonation, often accompanied by a force producing great amounts of heat, major structural damages, shock waves and flying shrapnel. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.name: explosion

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_by-.name: by-product
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_by-.definition: A useful and marketable product or service deriving from a manufacturing process that is not the primary product or service being produced. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_riv.name: river station
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_riv.definition: An established location along a river designated for observing and measuring properties of the river. [definition source: US National Weather Service of Central Region. Glossary of hydrologic terms.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.definition: The European Topic Centre on Nature Protection and Biodiversity (ETC/NPB, formerly European Topic Centre for Nature Conservation, ETC/NC), is one of five EEA's topic centres. It assists the EEA in its work of collecting, analysing, evaluating and synthesising information relevant to national and international policies for the environment and sustainable development. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.name: ETC/NPB

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rep.definition: Any of various processes, either sexual or asexual, by which an animal or plant produces one or more individuals similar to itself. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rep.name: reproduction (biological)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental impact statement
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_cs: prohlášení o vlivu na životní prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: анализ на въздействието върху околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: анализ на въздействието върху околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Report prepared on the completion of an Environmental Impact Assessment often submitted to the local planning authority in support of a development proposal. [definition source: European Commission, DGXI. 1999. Final report on the study of the assessment of indirect and cumulative impacts, as well as impact interactions within the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) process.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_cs: prohlášení o vlivu na životní prostředí

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.objecttrans_it: capacità di resistenza, capacità di carico
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.objectname_it: capacità di resistenza, capacità di carico
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.name: carrying capacity
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.objectname_bg: способност на екосиситемите (на земята) за въздействие върху околната среда без значителни щети
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.objecttrans_bg: способност на екосиситемите (на земята) за въздействие върху околната среда без значителни щети
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.definition: The maximum number of organisms of a given species that can be supported in a given habitat or geographic area. [definition source: The Encyclopedia of Ecology & Environment Management. Ed. Peter Calow. Blackwell Science Ltd. 1998.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_Kor.definition: Synonyms: KAMA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_Kor.name: Korea Automobile Manufacturers Association

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.name: ecotourism
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.definition: A trip to semi-natural areas to understand the natural and cultural history of the place visited, taking care of the integrity of the ecosystem; providing economical opportunities in order to allow the preservation of natural resources, benefiting the local population. [definition source: Adapted from: The Ecotourism Society. United States.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_co_.definition: Joint incineration of hazardous waste, in any form, with refuse and/or sludge. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_co_.name: co-incineration

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_el: οδηγία για τη στρατηγική εκτίμηση περιβαλλοντικών επιπτώσεων
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_hu: stratégiai környezeti hatásvizsgálati irányelv, az európa parlament és a tanács 2001. június 27-i, 2001/42/ec számú irányelve egyes tervek és programok környezetre gyakorolt hatásainak felbecsüléséről
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_es: directiva relativa a la evaluación de los efectos de determinados planes y programas en el medio ambiente
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_it: direttiva relativa alla valutazione ambientale strategica
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_pl: dyrektywa w sprawie oceny strategii na rzecz ochrony środowiska
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_it: direttiva relativa alla valutazione ambientale strategica
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_es: directiva relativa a la evaluación de los efectos de determinados planes y programas en el medio ambiente
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.name: strategic environmental assessment directive
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_pl: Dyrektywa w sprawie oceny strategii na rzecz ochrony środowiska
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_hu: stratégiai környezeti hatásvizsgálati irányelv, az Európa Parlament és a Tanács 2001. június 27-i, 2001/42/EC számú irányelve egyes tervek és programok környezetre gyakorolt hatásainak felbecsüléséről
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_el: οδηγία για τη στρατηγική εκτίμηση περιβαλλοντικών επιπτώσεων
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_cs: směrnice o strategickém posuzování vlivů na životní prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_bg: директива за стратегическа оценка на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_ro: directiva cu privire la strategiile de mediu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_bg: директива за стратегическа оценка на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.definition: Directive 2001/42/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment. Its objective is to provide for a high level of protection of the environment and to contribute to the integration of environmental considerations into the preparation and adoption of plans and programmes with a view to promoting sustainable development, by ensuring that an environmental assessment is carried out of certain plans and programmes which are likely to have significant effects on the environment. [definition source: Adapted from: Directive 2001/42/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment (Article 1)]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_cs: směrnice o strategickém posuzování vlivů na životní prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_ro: directiva cu privire la strategiile de mediu

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pet.definition: Light hydrocarbon oil for use in internal combustion engines, excluding those in aircraft. Motor gasoline is distilled between 35oC and 215oC and treated by reforming, catalytic cracking or blending with an aromatic fraction to reach a sufficiently high octane number (>80 RON). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pet.name: petrol

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inc.objectname_pt: incineração de detritos; incineração de resíduos
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inc.name: incineration (of waste)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inc.objecttrans_pt: incineração de detritos; incineração de resíduos
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_inc.definition: The process of burning solid waste under controlled conditions to reduce its weight and volume, and often to produce energy. [definition source: The Global Development Research Centre. Solid waste management. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_RER.definition: Synonyms: Regional Environmental Reconstruction Programme [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_RER.name: REReP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.definition: In statistics, the frequency of an event is simply the number of times the event occurred in the experiment or the study. These frequencies are often graphically represented in histograms. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.name: statistical frequency

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.definition: An element that is naturally radioactive. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.name: radioelement

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: groundwater
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: All water which is below the surface of the ground in the saturation zone and in direct contact with the ground of the soil. [definition source: Directive 2000/60/EC of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (Water Framework Directive).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_k.definition: Synonyms: kilo [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_k.name: k

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European waste catalogue
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: A source and process-based listing of wastes. The European waste catalogue was established in December 1993 by Commission Decision 94/3/EC and includes 645 waste types. [definition source: Adapted from: EEA. 2000. Hazardous waste generation in selected European countries. Topic report No 14/1999. Copenhagen.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Synonyms: EPR [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental performance review

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_RPG.definition: Synonyms: regional priority goals [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_RPG.name: RPG

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_noi.definition: Physical quantity of sound measured, usually expressed in decibels. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_noi.name: noise level

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ant.objecttrans_is: fyrir fram gefin sýn á stöðu mála
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ant.objectname_is: fyrir fram gefin sýn á stöðu mála
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ant.name: anticipatory scenario
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ant.definition: Anticipatory scenarios (also known as prescriptive or normative scenarios) start with a prescribed vision of the future (either optimistic, pessimistic or neutral) and then work backwards in time to visualise how this future could emerge. [definition source: Alcampo, J. Scenarios as Tools for International Environmental Assessments.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dic.definition: Synonyms: DDE [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dic.name: dichlorodiphenyl dichloroethylene

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.name: non-renewable resource
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.definition: Minerals, oil, gas and coal. Their use as material and energy sources leads to depletion of the Earth's reserves and are characterised that they do not renew in human relevant periods. [definition source: European Commission. 2000. Analysis of the fundamental concepts of resource management.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.definition: A statement of a country's intentions in the energy sector. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.name: energy policy

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SOM.definition: for ozone, the sum of means over 35 ppb (daily maximum 8-hour) [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SOM.name: SOMO35

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.definition: Synonyms: UNICEF [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.name: United Nations Children's Fund

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Air.definition: Synonyms: AQDD [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Air.name: Air Quality Daughter Directives

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aqu.name: aquatic ecosystem
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aqu.definition: Basic ecological unit composed of living and non-living elements interacting in an aqueous milieu. [definition source: Environment Canada. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nit.definition: Nitrogen oxides refers to nitric oxide gas (NO) and nitrogen dioxide gas (NO2) and many other gaseous oxides containing nitrogen. The main source of these gases in urban areas are motor vehicle exhaust and indoor gas stoves and kerosene heaters. The brown haze sometimes seen over cities is mainly nitrogen oxides. These gases are also partly responsible for the generation of ozone, which is produced when nitrogen oxides react with other chemicals in the presence of sunlight. Exposure to high levels of nitrogen dioxide can interfere with the ability of blood to carry oxygen, leading to dizziness and shortness of breath. Prolonged exposure can lead to respiratory failure. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nit.name: nitrogen oxides

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.objectname_pl: konsorcjum etc, konsorcja europejskich ośrodków tematycznych
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.name: ETC consortium
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.objecttrans_pl: konsorcjum ETC, konsorcja Europejskich ośrodków tematycznych
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.objectname_bg: етс - консорциум европейски тематичен център ( по специфични теми на околната среда)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.objecttrans_bg: ЕТС - консорциум Европейски тематичен център ( по специфични теми на околната среда)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.definition: The European topic centres (ETCs) designated to date are multi-institutional (multi-organisational) consortia consisting of a lead organisation, which provides the ETC manager and a number (currently between 7 and 12) of partner organisations (ETC partners). Thus, an ETC consortium consists of ETC lead organisation and ETC partners. [definition source: EEA. G. McInnes. 2001. A brief guide to who does what in the EEA and EIONET. Copenhagen.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aco.definition: Physical quantity of sound measured, usually expressed in decibels. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aco.name: acoustic level

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TEA.definition: Synonyms: Technology and Economic Assessment Panel [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TEA.name: TEAP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_asb.definition: Disease associated with inhalation of asbestos fibres. The disease makes breathing progressively more difficult and can be fatal. [definition source: US EPA. Terms of environment.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_asb.name: asbestosis

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pos.objectname_hu: a fogyasztó által meghagyott anyagok, maradék anyagok, már nem szükséges anyagok
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pos.name: post-consumer materials
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pos.objecttrans_hu: a fogyasztó által meghagyott anyagok, maradék anyagok, már nem szükséges anyagok
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pos.definition: Materials that a consumer has finished using, which the consumer may sell, give away, or discard as wastes. [definition source: The Global Development Research Centre. Solid waste management. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cra.definition: 'Cradle-to-grave' assessment considers impacts at each stage of a product's life-cycle, from the time natural resources are extracted from the ground and processed through each subsequent stage of manufacturing, transportation, product use, and ultimately, disposal. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cra.name: cradle to grave

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GDP.definition: The total output of goods and services produced by a national economy in a given period, usually a year, valued at market prices. It is gross, since no allowance is made for the value of replacement of capital goods. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GDP.name: GDP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_REA.definition: Synonyms: registration, evaluation, authorisation and restriction of chemicals [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_REA.name: REACH

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bod.name: body of groundwater
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bod.definition: A distinct volume of groundwater within an aquifer or aquifers. [definition source: Directive 2000/60/EC of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (Water Framework Directive).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_LRT.definition: Atmospheric transport of air pollutants within a moving air mass for a distance greater than 100 kilometres. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of Eenvironment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_LRT.name: LRTAP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.name: dissolved solids
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.definition: Disintegrated organic and inorganic material contained in water. Excessive amounts make water unsuitable for drinking or for use in industrial processes. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coa.name: coastal environment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coa.definition: The areas where the land masses meet the seas. Coastal environments include tidal wetlands, estuaries, bays, shallow near-shore waters, mangrove swamps, and in-shore reef systems. The critical habitats of these zones are: feeding, breeding, nursery, and resting areas. Coastal areas throughout the world are under enormous environmental stress, which is caused by a wide range of factors, including pollution and the destruction and deterioration of marine habitats. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lif.name: life cycle cost
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lif.definition: The cost of a good or service over its entire life cycle. [definition source: Global Change Electronic Edition.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bot.definition: A place in which plants are grown, studied and exhibited. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bot.name: botanic garden

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lif.definition: The number of years that a person can expect to live on average, based on estimation of data on death rates of the population. Life expectancy depends on age. For example, at birth a person may be expected to live for 75 years, but if the person survives to 75, he or she may be expected to live for another 10 years. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lif.name: life-expectancy

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.definition: A value that is the rank at a particular point in a collection of data. For instance, a 98th percentile of values for a year is the value that 98 % of all the data in the year fall below, or equal. [definition source: UK National Air Quality Information Archive. Glossary of air pollution terms.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.name: percentile

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.objectname_sk: odpad po ťažbe nerastov, banský odpad
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.name: mining waste
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.objecttrans_sk: odpad po ťažbe nerastov, banský odpad
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.objectname_bg: отпадъци от минни работи (от разработването на полезни изкопаеми
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.objecttrans_bg: отпадъци от минни работи (от разработването на полезни изкопаеми
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.definition: Any residue which results from the extraction of raw materials from the earth. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_imm.definition: A body system that helps an organism to resist disease,through the activities of specialised blood cells or antibodies produced by them in response to natural exposure or inoculation. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_imm.name: immune system

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_kil.definition: Synonyms: k [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_kil.name: kilo

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nuc.definition: A power plant in which nuclear energy is converted into heat for use in producing steam for turbines, which in turn drive generators that produce electric power. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nuc.name: nuclear power plant

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNE.definition: Synonyms: United Nations Environment Programme [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNE.name: UNEP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fin.definition: Synonyms: FEC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fin.name: final energy consumption

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IDA.definition: Interchange of data between administrations (IDA) is the European Commission's programme for linking Member States' administrations with Community institutions. It supports sectoral networks with generic and interoperable services. [definition source: EEA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IDA.name: IDA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_liq.definition: Synonyms: LPG [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_liq.name: liquified petroleum gas

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MAB.definition: UNESCO's programme on man and the biosphere (MAB) develops the basis, within the natural and the social sciences, for the sustainable use and conservation of biological diversity, and for the improvement of the relationship between people and their environment globally. The MAB programme encourages interdisciplinary research, demonstration and training in natural resource management. [definition source: UNESCO.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MAB.name: MAB programme

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_HPV.definition: Chemicals placed on the EU market in volumes exceeding 1000 tonnes per year per manufacturer or importer. [definition source: European Commission. 2001. White paper on strategy for a future chemical policy. COM(2001) 88 final. Brussels.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_HPV.name: HPV chemical

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ero.definition: Soil erosion consists in the removal of soil material by water or wind. It is a natural phenomenon but it can be accelerated by human activities. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ero.name: erosion of the soil

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mun.definition: Discharge of effluent from wastewater treatment plants which receive wastewater from households, commercial establishments, and industries. Combined sewer/separate storm overflows are included in this category. [definition source: Based on: US EPA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mun.name: municipal sewage

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: interest group
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objectname_bg: група по интереси за сътрудничество по проекти
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_bg: група по интереси за сътрудничество по проекти
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Collaboration areas for projects in CIRCA (Communication and Information Resource Centre Administrator). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GMP.definition: Synonyms: global monitoring plan [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GMP.name: GMP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ino.name: inorganic waste
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ino.definition: Waste composed of material other than plant or animal matter, such as sand, dust, glass and many synthetics. [definition source: The Global Development Research Centre. Solid waste management. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_reu.objectname_lv: materiālu otrreizēja izmantošana bez izmaiņām to struktūrā
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_reu.name: reuse
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_reu.objecttrans_lv: materiālu otrreizēja izmantošana bez izmaiņām to struktūrā
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_reu.definition: Material reuse without any structural changes in materials. [definition source: European Statistical Laboratory.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CPR.definition: Synonyms: continuous plankton recorder [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CPR.name: CPR

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.definition: A benefit or a cost not included in the market price of the good and services being produced, i.e. costs not borne by those who create them and benefits not paid by those who receive them. [definition source: IMO/UNESCO/WMO/WHO/IAEA/UN/UNEP. Joint group of experts of the scientific aspects of marine environmental protection. Protecting the oceans from land-based activities.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ext.name: external cost/benefit

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.definition: 1) Refers to the relative proportions of the various size groups (sand, silt and clay) of the individual soil grains in a mass of soil. 2) Classification of soil by the proportion and graduations of the three size groups of soil grains, i.e., sand, silt and clay, present in the soil. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.name: soil texture

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ove.name: overexploitation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ove.objectname_bg: хищна (т. е. дълготрайна, екстензивна) експлоатация на природни ресурси
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ove.objecttrans_bg: хищна (т. е. дълготрайна, екстензивна) експлоатация на природни ресурси
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ove.definition: The use of raw materials excessively without considering the long-term ecological impacts of such use. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.definition: Eastern Europe, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary and Kazakhstan [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.name: EUR-C

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.definition: most of the Caucasus, Central Asia and south-eastern Europe, Poland and Slovakia [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.name: EUR-B

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.definition: EU-15, EFTA and other western European countries, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Cyprus and Malta [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.name: EUR-A

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gra.definition: Synonyms: g [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gra.name: gram

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: An extension of the economic notion of capital (manufactured means of production) to environmental 'goods and services'. It refers to a stock (e.g., a forest) which produces a flow of goods (e.g., new trees) and services (e.g., carbon sequestration, erosion control, habitat). [definition source: Industry Canada. Eco-efficiency glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural capital

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: An ecosystem where human impact has been of no greater influence than that of any other native species, and has not affected the ecosystem's structure since the industrial revolution. Human impact excludes changes of global proportions, such as climate change due to global warming. [definition source: European Commission. Forest in sustainable development.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural ecosystem

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hab.objectname_hu: élőhelytípus, termőhelytípus, környezettípus, előfordulási hely típusa
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hab.name: habitat type
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hab.objecttrans_hu: élőhelytípus, termőhelytípus, környezettípus, előfordulási hely típusa
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hab.definition: Plant and animal communities as the characterising elements of the biotic environment, together with abiotic factors (soil, climate, water availability and quality, and others), operating together at a particular scale. The term 'habitat type' is often used synonymously with 'ecosystem'. [definition source: Adapted from: EUNIS. EUNIS habitats classification. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pro.definition: Threatened, vulnerable or endangered species which are protected from extinction by preventive measures. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pro.name: protected species

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_kel.definition: Marine ecosystem dominated by large kelps. These forests are restricted to cold and temperate waters, and are most common along the western coasts of continents. [definition source: University of California. Berkeley. UCMP Glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_K_kel.name: kelp forest

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rur.name: rural tourism
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rur.definition: The activities of a person travelling and staying in rural areas (without mass tourism) other than those of their usual environment for less than one consecutive year for leisure, business and other purposes (excluding the exercise of an activity remunerated from within the placed visited). [definition source: Eurostat. 1998. Community Methodology on Tourism Statistics. European Commission. Luxembourg.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gyr.name: gyre
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gyr.definition: The roughly circular patterns assumed by the major surface currents in the world's oceans. Centred on the subtropical high pressure cells, the water in these gyres circulates clock-wise in the northern hemisphere and anti-clock-wise in the south, under the influence of the atmospheric circulation. [definition source: Kemp, David D. 1998. The environment dictionary. Routledge. London.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GMO.definition: The modification of the genetic characteristics of a microorganism, plant or animal by inserting a modified gene or a gene from another variety or species. Genetically modified organisms (GMOs) may be microorganisms designed for use as biopesticides or seeds that have been altered genetically to give a plant better disease resistance or growth. [definition source: K. ten Kate & S.A. Laird. 1999. The Commercial Use of Biodiversity: Access to Genetic Resources and Benefit-Sharing. European Commission. Quoted by: Convention of Biological Diversity Secretariat. Belgian Clearing-House Mechanism.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GMO.name: GMO

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ani.definition: Animal excreta collected from stables and barnyards with or without litter; used to enrich the soil. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ani.name: animal manure

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ora.definition: Adverse effects resulting from taking a substance into the body by mouth. [definition source: University of Texas. MSDS Glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ora.name: oral toxicity

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objectname_lv: specializēta suga, suga, kas dzīvo tikai vienā dzīvotnē, pārtiek no viena veida barības, utt.
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objectname_hu: {natbio} termőhely-specifikus fajok, élőhely-specifikus fajok, klimarezisztenciás fajok
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.name: specialist species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objecttrans_hu: {NATBIO} termőhely-specifikus fajok, élőhely-specifikus fajok, klimarezisztenciás fajok
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objecttrans_lv: specializēta suga, suga, kas dzīvo tikai vienā dzīvotnē, pārtiek no viena veida barības, utt.
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objectname_nl: specialistische soort, soort die tolerant is t.o.v. milieufactoren (euryoec)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.definition: A species that uses a relatively small proportion (in extreme cases only one) of the available resources types. [definition source: The Encyclopedia of Ecology & Environment Management. Ed. Peter Calow. Blackwell Science Ltd. 1998.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objecttrans_nl: specialistische soort, soort die tolerant is t.o.v. milieufactoren (euryoec)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_sk: ručenie za škody na životnom prostredí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental liability
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_cs: odpovědnost za škody na životním prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_sk: ručenie za škody na životnom prostredí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: отговорност за вреди, нанесени на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: отговорност за вреди, нанесени на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Liability for damage to nature and environment. Environmental liability makes the causer of environmental damage pay for remedying the damage that he has caused. [definition source: Adapted from: European Commission. 2000. White paper on environmental liability. COM(2000) 66final.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_cs: odpovědnost za škody na životním prostředí

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_lt: indikatoriumi pagrįsta stebėjimo ir kontrolės sistema
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_es: sistema de control basado en indicadores
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_it: sistema di monitoraggio basato su indicatori
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_it: sistema di monitoraggio basato su indicatori
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_pt: sistema de monitorização baseado em indicadores
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objectname_es: sistema de control basado en indicadores
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.name: indicator-based monitoring system
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_lt: indikatoriumi pagrįsta stebėjimo ir kontrolės sistema
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_pt: sistema de monitorização baseado em indicadores

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ind.objecttrans_ro: Sistem de monitorizare bazat pe indicatori

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.definition: The procedure in which the risks posed by inherent hazards involved in processes or situations are estimated either quantitatively or qualitatively. [definition source: EEA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.name: risk assessment

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hum.definition: Areas that are inundated by surface or ground water with frequency sufficient to support a prevalence of vegetative or aquatic life that requires saturated or seasonally saturated soil conditions for growth or reproduction. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hum.name: humid zone

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pan.objectname_ro: strategia paneuropenă cu privire la ambient şi la diversitatea biologică
