glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sat.definition: Satellite Pour l'Observation de la Terre (SPOT).SPOT - the Satellite Earth Observation System was designed in France, and developed with the participation of Sweden and Belgium. The system comprises a series of spacecrafts plus ground facilities for satellite control and programming, image production and distribution.The SPOT satellites capture panchromatic and multispectral imagery in resolutions ranging from 2.5m to 20m. The satellites are fitted with two independent imaging instruments, containing detector arrays that operate using a 'Push Broom' technique. This results in high geometric accuracy across the full 60km wide swath. Each instrument is also fitted with a steerable mirror that allows it to image areas up to 27 degrees east or west off the vertical, which increases the revisit capability and provides stereo imagery for digital elevation modelling. Importantly, the SPOT satellites can be programmed to target client specific areas of interest. History: SPOT 1 was launched on 22 February 1986 with 10m panchromatic and 20m multispectral capability. The satellite was withdrawn from active service on 31 December 1990. SPOT 2 was launched on 22 January 1990 and is still operational. SPOT 3 was launched on 26 September 1993. An incident occurred on 14 November 1997 and after 4 years in orbit the satellite stopped functioning. SPOT 4 was launched on 24 March 1998 and includes an extra Short Wave Infrared band and a (low resolution) vegetation instrument. SPOT 5 was launched on 4 May 2002 with 2.5m, 5m and 10m capability, as well as along-track stereoscopic sensors. System continuity will be assured by a constellation of new-generation minisatellites known as Pleiades. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sat.name: Satellite Earth Observation System

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EMA.definition: A Community scheme allowing voluntary participation by companies performing industrial activities, established for the evaluation and improvement of the environmental performance of industrial activities and the provision of the relevant information to the public. The objective of the scheme is to promote continuous improvements in the environmental performance of industrial activities by:(a) the establishment and implementation of environmental policies, programmes and management systems by companies, in relation to their sites;(b) the systematic, objective and periodic evaluation of the performance of such elements;(c) the provision of information of environmental performance to the public. [definition source: Adapted from: European Commission.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EMA.name: EMAS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_col.definition: The collective dose (S) to a population or group is given by the summation S = Hi x Pi, where Hi is the dose to the whole body or to a specified organ averaged over the Pi members of the ith subgroup of the population or group. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_col.name: collective dose

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.definition: A component of the climate system that has the capacity to store, to accumulate, or to release a substance of concern (e.g., carbon, a greenhouse gas, or precursor). Oceans, soils, and forests are examples of reservoirs of carbon. The term also means an artificial or natural storage place for water, such as a lake, pond, or aquifer, from which the water may be withdrawn for such purposes as irrigation or water supply. [definition source: Based on: IPCC. Climate change 2001 impacts, adaptation and vulnerability.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.name: reservoir

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.name: conifers
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.definition: A wide range of tree species within the order Gymnospermae, typically evergreen, bearing cones, and having needle-shaped or scale-like leaves. [definition source: IUFRO Silva term database.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.objectname_tr: biyogãŧvenlik iåbirliäi ve bilgi aläąåveriåi mekanizmasäą
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.definition: The biosafety clearing-house was established by article 20 of the Cartagena Protocol on biosafety. It provides access to information relevant to the operation of the Biosafety Protocol. [definition source: Biosafety Clearing-House.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.objecttrans_tr: biyogÃŧvenlik iÅbirliÄi ve bilgi alÄąÅveriÅi mekanizmasÄą
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.name: biosafety clearing-house mechanism

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.name: transboundary pollution
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tra.definition: Polluted air and water, or any other contaminated waste, that is generated in one country and transmitted to others. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rei.definition: Reintroduction of exterminated species in an area; it is bound to fail if the chosen animal became extinct in the area too long ago and if the area itself has undergone too many changes. Reintroduction needs years of careful planning - the approval of local population, technical conditions of the release, feeding system, protection and breeding control - and even then some unexpected problems may arise. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rei.name: reintroduction

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Euro I passenger cars are cars that comply with the emission standards as defined in Directive 91/441/EEC. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: Euro I

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_N2O.definition: Relatively inert oxide of nitrogen produced as a result of microbial action in the soil, use of fertilisers containing nitrogen, burning of timber, chemical industry, and so forth. This nitrogen compound may contribute to greenhouse and ozone-depleting effects. [definition source: Based on: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_N2O.name: N2O

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CMP.definition: Synonyms: Conference of the Parties serving as the Meeting of the Parties to the Kyoto Protocol [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CMP.name: CMP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objectname_tr: akdeniz'deki ulusal eylem programlaräąnäąn desteklenmesi iã§in ã§ãļlleåme bilgi sistemi
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.definition: The overall objective of the desertification information system to support national action programmes in the Mediterranean (DIS/MED) project is to improve the capacity of national administrations in the Mediterranean countries to effectively program measures and policies to combat desertification and the effects of drought by reinforcing communication, facilitating the exchange of information and establishing a common information system to monitor the physical and socio-economic conditions in areas threatened or affected by desertification and drought and to assess the extent, severity and trends of land degradation in those areas. [definition source: UNCCD Secretariat. 2001. Desertification information system to support national action programmes in the Mediterranean (DIS/MED). Technical workshop on NAP information needs: terms of reference.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objecttrans_tr: Akdeniz'deki ulusal eylem programlarÄąnÄąn desteklenmesi iÃ§in Ã§ÃļlleÅme bilgi sistemi
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.name: desertification information system to support national action programmes in the Mediterranean
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objecttrans_en: desertification information system to support national action programmes in the Mediterranean
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.objectname_en: desertification information system to support national action programmes in the mediterranean

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.definition: Synonyms: TOFP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.name: tropospheric ozone forming potentials

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.definition: Facility to measure systematically concentrations of pollutants in ambient air. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.name: air quality monitoring station

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.definition: A waste disposal site for the deposit of the waste onto or into land (i.e. underground). [definition source: Directive 1999/31/EC of 26 April 1999 on the landfill of waste.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.name: disposal site

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.definition: Respiratory disease is an acute or chronic illness affecting the respiratory system; includes acute respiratory infections, bronchitis, pneumonia, influenza, and chronic obstructive pulmonary diseases. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.name: respiratory disease

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_liv.definition: An individual constituted to carry out all life functions. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_liv.name: living being

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Inc.definition: Directive 2000/76/EC on the incineration of waste. The aim of this directive if to prevent or to limit, as far as practicable, negative effects on the environment, in particular pollution by emissions into air, soil, surface water and ground-water, and the resulting risks to human health, from the incineration and co-incineration of waste. [definition source: Directive 2000/76/EC on the incineration of waste (art. 1).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Inc.name: Incineration Directive

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_el: βάση δεδομένων EUNIS για τους οικοτόπους
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_hu: eunis élőhely-adatbázis (az európai természetvédelmi információs rendszer - eunis - által működtetett élőhely-adatbázis)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_es: EUNIS, base de datos de hábitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_pl: siedliskowa baza danych europejskiej sieci informacji o przyrodzie eunis
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_pt: base de dados eunis sobre habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_es: eunis, base de datos de hábitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.name: EUNIS habitats database
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_pl: siedliskowa baza danych Europejskiej Sieci Informacji o Przyrodzie EUNIS
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_hu: EUNIS élőhely-adatbázis (Az Európai Természetvédelmi Információs Rendszer - EUNIS - által működtetett élőhely-adatbázis)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_el: βάση δεδομένων eunis για τους οικοτόπους
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_pt: base de dados EUNIS sobre habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_fr: base de données eunis sur les habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_ro: baza de date eunis asupra habitatelor
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_fr: base de données EUNIS sur les habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.definition: Database developed by the EEA European Topic Centre on Nature Protection and Biodiversity with the goal of including basic information (mostly habitat description and distribution) on habitat types of European concern. [definition source: Adapted from: EEA ETC/NPB.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_ro: baza de date EUNIS asupra habitatelor

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.definition: Soil is a three-dimensional body performing a wide range of socio-economic and ecological functions. It is a complex media formed by a porous matrix, in which air, water and biota occur together with the fluxes of substances and fluids between these elements. Alteration of soil processes leads to changes in the functioning of ecosystems, and many environmental problems which become apparent in other media actually originate within the soil. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_soi.name: soil

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GTZ.definition: Synonyms: Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Technische Zusammenarbeit GmbH [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GTZ.name: GTZ

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.definition: Synonyms: UNCLOS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.name: United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.objecttrans_en: United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.objectname_en: united nations convention on the law of the sea

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_map.definition: A map projection is any of many methods used in cartography (mapmaking) to represent the two-dimensional curved surface of the earth or other body on a plane. Methods for constructing a projection may be mathematical, graphical, or geometric. Regardless of the method, in the end any projection can be expressed mathematically. Flat maps could not exist without map projections. Flat maps can be more useful than models globes in many situations: they are more compact and easier to store; they readily accommodate an enormous range of scales; they are viewed easily on computer diplays; they can facilitate measuring properties of the terrain being mapped; they can show larger portions of the earth's surface at once; and they are cheaper to produce and transport. These useful traits of flat maps motivate the development of map projections. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_map.name: map projection

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hal.name: halon
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hal.definition: Bromine-containing compounds with long atmospheric lifetimes whose breakdown in the stratosphere causes depletion of ozone. Halons are used in firefighting. [definition source: USA EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sus.definition: Synonyms: SCP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sus.name: sustainable consumption and production

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_ST-.definition: Synonyms: Sustainable Tourism - Eliminating Poverty [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_ST-.name: ST-EP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_liv.definition: Population of cattle, goats, equine, sheep, pig, and hens by categories. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_liv.name: livestock

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_poi.name: point source
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_poi.objectname_bg: пунктов, индивидуално идентифицируем източник на замърсяване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_poi.objecttrans_bg: пунктов, индивидуално идентифицируем източник на замърсяване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_poi.definition: A stationary location or fixed facility from which pollutants are discharged; any single identifiable source of pollution; e.g. a pipe, ditch, ship, ore pit, factory smokestack. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_met.definition: Variables, such as pressure, temperature, wind strength, humidity, etc. from which conclusions as to the forthcoming weather are drawn. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_met.name: meteorological parameter

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fis.definition: The total quantity of fish that is retained by fishing gear and brought onto the deck or fishing station, i.e. landings plus discards. [definition source: Countryside Council for Wales. 2001. A glossary on marine nature conservation and fisheries. United Kingdom.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fis.name: fish catch

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cop.name: coppice forest
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cop.definition: Woodland which has been regenerated from shoots formed at the stumps of the previous crop trees, root suckers, or both, i.e., by vegetative means. Normally grown on a short rotation for small material, but sometimes, e.g. some eucalyptus species, to a substantial size. [definition source: IUFRO Silva term database.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_J_joi.objectname_lv: kopīgā projektu īstenošana: kioto protokolā noteiktais mehānisms kaitīgo izmešu samazināšanai
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_J_joi.name: joint implementation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_J_joi.objecttrans_lv: kopīgā projektu īstenošana: Kioto protokolā noteiktais mehānisms kaitīgo izmešu samazināšanai
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_J_joi.definition: The Kyoto Protocol establishes this mechanism whereby Annex I Parties (listed in Annex B of the Kyoto Protocol) can receive emissions reduction units when it helps to finance projects that reduce net emissions in an Annex I Party country. [definition source: European Commission. 1999. Work programme for RTD actions in support of 'competitive and sustainable growth' 1998-2000.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_oil.definition: Contamination of any ecosystem, but usually of freshwater or marine ecosystems, by oil or other petroleum products. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_oil.name: oil pollution

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_ter.definition: The continental as distinct from the marine and atmospheric environments. It is the environment in which terrestrial organisms live. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_ter.name: terrestrial ecosystem

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_win.definition: The motion of air relative to the earth's surface; usually means horizontal air motion, as distinguished from vertical motion. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_win.name: wind

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_flu.definition: Synonyms: F-gases [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_flu.name: fluorinated gases

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_sk: hodnotenie vplyvov stratégií na životné prostredie
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.name: strategic environmental assessment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_cs: strategické posuzování vlivů na životní prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objecttrans_sk: hodnotenie vplyvov stratégií na životné prostredie
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.definition: A similar technique to environmental impact assessment (EIA) but normally applied to policies, plans, programmes and groups of projects. Strategic environmental assessment (SEA) provides the potential opportunity to avoid the preparation and implementation of inappropriate plants, programmes and projects and assists in the identification and evaluation of project alternatives and identification of cumulative effects. SEA comprises two main types: sectoral SEA (applied when many new projects fall within one sector) and regional SEA (applied when broad economic development is planned within one region). [definition source: European Commission. 1999. Integrating environment concerns into development and economic cooperation. Draft version 1.0. Brussels]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_str.objectname_cs: strategické posuzování vlivů na životní prostředí

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lim.definition: Abiotic condition that most controls the growth of a species. For most terrestrial plants this condition is the supply of the nutrient nitrogen in the soil. [definition source: Okanagan University College.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lim.name: limiting factor

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.objectname_de: nicht produktive landbewirtschaftung, nicht produktive bodenbewirtschaftung
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.objecttrans_de: nicht produktive Landbewirtschaftung, nicht produktive Bodenbewirtschaftung
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.name: non-productive land management

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.name: waste reclamation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.definition: Conversion of solid wastes into useful products, for example, composting organic waste to make soil conditioners, and separating aluminium and other metals for melting and recycling. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wai.definition: A reactive method of dealing with the environment that places the burden of proof on those who would conserve. (Opposite: the precautionary principle). [definition source: European Community Biodiversity Clearing-House Mechanism. Glossary of terms related to the CBD.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wai.name: wait-and-see principle

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: Land and water areas where the ecosystems biological communities are formed largely by native plant and animal species and human activity has not essentially modified the area's primary ecological functions. [definition source: World Bank. Quoted by: European Commission. Environmental integration manual.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural habitat

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.definition: Transporting unwanted materials, including those leftover from a manufacturing processes, refuse, or trash to other countries or areas for the conduct of foreign trade. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.name: waste export

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sce.name: scenario
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sce.definition: A plausible description of how the future may develop, based on a coherent and internally consistent set of assumptions about key relationships and driving forces (e.g. rate of technology changes, prices). Note that scenarios are neither predictions nor forecast. [definition source: Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gre.definition: Electricity produced from resources such as solar, wind, geothermal, biomass, and low-impact hydro facilities is often referred to as 'green electricity'. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gre.name: green electricity

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_es: hábitats de lodos, pantanos y marjales
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_sv: livsmilöjer i myr-, kärr och träskmark
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_da: levesteder i eng-, kær- og moseområder
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_da: levesteder i eng-, kær- og moseområder
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_pt: habitats de turfeiras, sapais e pântanos
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_es: hábitats de lodos, pantanos y marjales
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.name: mire, bog and fen habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_pt: habitats de turfeiras, sapais e pântanos
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_fr: habitats des bourbiers, maraicages et fagnes
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_nl: laagveen- en veenmoerashabitats (al dan niet met vegetatie)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_sv: livsmilöjer I myr-, kärr och träskmark
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objectname_ro: habitate de noroi, mlaştină şi luncă
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_fr: habitats des bourbiers, maraicages et fagnes
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.definition: One of the main habitat types in the EUNIS habitats classification. Habitats which are saturated, with the water table at or above ground level for at least half of the year, dominated by herbaceous or ericoid vegetation e.g. bogs, marshes. Includes waterlogged habitats where the groundwater is frozen. Excludes waterlogged habitats dominated by trees or large shrubs. Note that habitats which intimately combine waterlogged habitats with pools of open water are considered as complexes. [definition source: Davies, C. E. and Moss, D. 1999. Quoted by: EUNIS. EUNIS habitats classification. Glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_ro: habitate de noroi, mlaştină şi luncă
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mir.objecttrans_nl: laagveen- en veenmoerashabitats (al dan niet met vegetatie)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.definition: Synonyms: CMR [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_car.name: carcinogenic, mutagenic and repro-toxic chemicals

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tot.definition: Synonyms: TSP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tot.name: total suspended particles

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_AQF.definition: Directive 96/62/EC on ambient air quality assessment and management. It provides a framework for setting in daughter-directives limit values for a range of pollutants, for assessing their concentrations and for managing air quality to avoid and prevent any exceedances of these limit values. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_AQF.name: AQFD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_scr.definition: Car which is delivered for breaking up or otherwise discarded. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_scr.name: scrap vehicle

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IUC.definition: A European Commission database used to store and distribute information collected under Regulation 793/93 on the evaluation and control of the risks of existing substances. [definition source: Adapted from: European Commission. 2001. White paper on Strategy for a Future Chemical Policy. COM(2001) 88 final. Brussels.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IUC.name: IUCLID

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objectname_de: neulandgewinnung, landgewinnung, urbarmachung, wiedergewinnung von land, rekultivierung, kultivierung
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objecttrans_de: Neulandgewinnung, Landgewinnung, Urbarmachung, Wiedergewinnung von Land, Rekultivierung, Kultivierung
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.name: land reclamation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objectname_nl: terreinsanering, herstel van land en bodem
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objectname_bg: инженеринг на изоставени, запуснати земи, за да се ползват за дадена цел
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objecttrans_bg: инженеринг на изоставени, запуснати земи, за да се ползват за дадена цел
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.definition: The engineering of derelict terrain so that it can be used for some purpose. [definition source: Surface Mining and Reclamation Act of 1975. California Department of Conservation, Division of Mines and Geology. United States. Quoted by: The Habitat Restoration Group.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objecttrans_nl: terreinsanering, herstel van land en bodem

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.definition: Direct or indirect introduction by humans of substances or energy into the marine environment (including estuaries), resulting in harm to living resources, hazards to human health, hindrances to marine activities including fishing, impairment of the quality of sea water and reduction of amenities. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.name: marine pollution

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sus.definition: Use of the environment and its living resources at a rate that does not exceed its capacity for renewal in order to ensure its availability for future generations. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sus.name: sustainable use

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_ha.definition: Synonyms: hectare [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_ha.name: ha

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bin.name: binding target
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bin.definition: Environmental standards that are to be met in the future. [definition source: Resources for the Future. United States.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.objectname_hu: {marenv} partközeli térség, a partvonalon túl, tengeri
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.objectname_de: offene see, offshore-, offshore, außerhalb von küstengewässern
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.objecttrans_de: offene See, Offshore-, offshore, außerhalb von Küstengewässern
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.name: offshore
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.objecttrans_hu: {MARENV} partközeli térség, a partvonalon túl, tengeri
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.objectname_bg: откъм сушата навътре във водата, шелф
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.objecttrans_bg: откъм сушата навътре във водата, шелф
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_off.definition: Away from the shoreline; refers largely to the expanse of submerged continental shelf on the ocean side of the shoreline but may also refer to areas nearer the ocean edge of the shelf. Used also to refer to the area beyond the three nautical miles State and territory waters. [definition source: FishBase Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fin.definition: Since 1994, the financial instrument for fisheries guidance has grouped together the Community instruments for fisheries. It is applied in all coastal regions, its main task being to increase the competitiveness of the structures and develop viable business enterprises in the fishing industry while striving to maintain the balance between fishing capacities and available resources. [definition source: European Commission. Glossary Inforegio.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fin.name: financial instrument for fisheries guidance

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gri.definition: A pattern of regularly spaced horizontal and vertical lines forming squares on a map, a chart, an aerial photograph, or an optical device, used as a reference for locating points or pixels (image elements). Regular grid with square raster is also used for thematic mapping or modelling of environment processess in GIS. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gri.name: grid

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cir.definition: Something that takes place or comes to pass. Occurrence and happening are the most general: an everyday occurrence; a happening of no great importance.Event usually signifies a notable occurrence: major world events reported on the evening news. 'Great events make me quiet and calm; it is only trifles that irritate my nerves' Victoria.Incident may apply to a minor occurrence: a small incident blown out of proportion.The term may also refer to a distinct event of sharp identity and significance: a succession of exciting incidents.An episode is an incident in the course of a progression or within a larger sequence: 'Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain' Thomas Hardy.Circumstance denotes a particular incident or occurrence: 'Billy had found Alice, thus bringing about the odd circumstance of their renewing their acquaintanceship' Eleanor H. Porter. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cir.name: circumstance

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SID.definition: Synonyms: screening information data set [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SID.name: SIDS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.definition: Energy performance of a building is the amount of energy actually consumed or estimated to meet the different needs associated with a standardised use of the building, which may include, inter alia, heating, hot water heating, cooling,ventilation and lighting. This amount shall be reflected in one or more numeric indicators which have been calculated,taking into account insulation, technical and installation characteristics, design and positioning in relation to climatic aspects, solar exposure and influence of neighbouring structures,own-energy generation and other factors, including indoor climate, that influence the energy demand. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ene.name: energy performance of a building

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.objectname_sl: informacijski sistem o naravi in prekritju tal (natlan)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: Natlan (nature/land cover) is an information package designed for viewing and distributing EEA's information, data and applications on land cover and nature in a comprehensive and easy-to-use way for a wide public. Natlan is developed by EEA in close collaboration with its European Topic Centres on Land Cover (ETC/LC) and Nature Conservation (ETC/NC). [definition source: EEA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.objectname_cs: informační systém o přírodě a krajinném pokryvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.objecttrans_ro: sistem de informare cu privire la natură şi sol

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_hu: {soi} szennyezett hely / telek (anyagok, vegyi anyagok, mérgező anyagok, hulladék által), fertőzött hely / telek (mikroorganizmusok által)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.name: contaminated site
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objecttrans_hu: {SOI} szennyezett hely / telek (anyagok, vegyi anyagok, mérgező anyagok, hulladék által), fertőzött hely / telek (mikroorganizmusok által)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.definition: A location where as a result of human activity an unacceptable hazard to human health and ecosystems exists. Local contamination (contaminated sites) is a problem in restricted areas (or sites) around the source, where there is a direct link to the source of contamination. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eve.definition: Something that takes place or comes to pass. Occurrence and happening are the most general: an everyday occurrence; a happening of no great importance.Event usually signifies a notable occurrence: major world events reported on the evening news. 'Great events make me quiet and calm; it is only trifles that irritate my nerves' Victoria.Incident may apply to a minor occurrence: a small incident blown out of proportion.The term may also refer to a distinct event of sharp identity and significance: a succession of exciting incidents.An episode is an incident in the course of a progression or within a larger sequence: 'Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain' Thomas Hardy.Circumstance denotes a particular incident or occurrence: 'Billy had found Alice, thus bringing about the odd circumstance of their renewing their acquaintanceship' Eleanor H. Porter. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eve.name: event

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aff.name: afforestation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_aff.definition: The establishment of a forest, stand or tree crop on an area not previously forested, or on land from which forest cover has very long been absent. [definition source: IUFRO Silva term database.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.definition: One or more substances present in or on plants or products of plant origin, edible animal products or elsewhere in the environment and resulting from the use of a plant protection product, including their metabolites and products resulting from their degradation or reaction. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_res.name: residues of plant protection products

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nit.definition: Relatively inert oxide of nitrogen produced as a result of microbial action in the soil, use of fertilisers containing nitrogen, burning of timber, chemical industry, and so forth. This nitrogen compound may contribute to greenhouse and ozone-depleting effects. [definition source: Based on: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nit.name: nitrous oxide

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_el: βάση δεδομένων EUNIS για τις τοποθεσίες
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_es: EUNIS, base de datos de sitios

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_pt: base de dados eunis sobre sites
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_es: eunis, base de datos de sitios
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.name: EUNIS sites database
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_pl: baza danych o ostojach przyrody według Europejskiej Sieci Informacji o Przyrodzie EUNIS
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_el: βάση δεδομένων eunis για τις τοποθεσίες
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_pt: base de dados EUNIS sobre sites
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_fr: base de données eunis sur les sites
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_ro: baza de date eunis cu privire la aşezări
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_fr: base de données EUNIS sur les sites
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.definition: Database developed by the EEA European Topic Centre on Nature Protection and Biodiversity with the goal of including relevant information on nationally, Community and internationally designated areas. [definition source: Adapted from: EEA ETC/NPB.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_ro: baza de date EUNIS cu privire la aşezări

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.definition: An indicator of the output or value added generated per unit of material used. [definition source: Eurostat. 2001. Economy-wide material flow accounts and derived indicators. Luxembourg.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.name: material productivity

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.definition: Restoration of materials found in the waste stream to a beneficial use which may be for purposes other than the original use. [definition source: US EPA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.name: material reclamation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_el: ταξινόμηση οικοτόπων με το σύστημα EUNIS
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_hu: eunis élőhely-besorolás (az európai természetvédelmi információs rendszerben - eunis - használt élőhely-besorolási séma)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_pl: klasyfikacja siedlisk według europejskiej sieci informacji o przyrodzie eunis
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.name: EUNIS habitats classification
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_pl: klasyfikacja siedlisk według Europejskiej Sieci Informacji o Przyrodzie EUNIS
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objecttrans_hu: EUNIS élőhely-besorolás (az Európai Természetvédelmi Információs Rendszerben - EUNIS - használt élőhely-besorolási séma)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.objectname_el: ταξινόμηση οικοτόπων με το σύστημα eunis
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUN.definition: A common reporting language on habitat types at European level developed by the EEA European Topic Centre on Nature Protection and Biodiversity. The EUNIS habitats classification builds upon previous initiatives (Corine-biotopes followed by the palearctic habitats classification), but introduces agreed-upon criteria for the identification of each habitat unit and provides a correspondence with other classification-types (the two above-mentioned, Corine land-cover typology, habitats directive Annex I, Nordic classification system, and potentially other national systems). [definition source: Adapted from: EEA ETC/NPB.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.definition: Synonyms: NAO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.name: North Atlantic Oscillation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rip.objecttrans_is: við eða á vatns- eða árbakka
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rip.objectname_da: langs vandløbsbredder; knyttet til et vandløbs bredder, vandløbsnært
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rip.objecttrans_da: langs vandløbsbredder; knyttet til et vandløbs bredder, vandløbsnært
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rip.objectname_is: við eða á vatns- eða árbakka
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rip.name: riparian
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rip.definition: Riverine. Pertaining to a river bank. [definition source: Allaby, 1994. Quoted by: European Topic Centre on Nature Conservation. 1998. EUNIS habitat classification. Final draft with further revisions to marine habitats. United Kingdom.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TER.definition: Terrestrial environment information system (TERRIS) is the geographical information system that contains the geo-referenced information available at the EEA, organised in an optimum and consistent way. TERRIS allows managing the relevant data for the calculation and maintenance of a core set of indicators related to land and soil issues. [definition source: ETC/TE.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TER.name: TERRIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_irr.definition: Areas equipped to provide water to the crops. These include areas equipped for full and partial irrigation, spate irrigation areas, and equipped wetland or inland valley bottoms. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_irr.name: irrigated area

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TMR.definition: The total material requirement (TMR) expresses the total mass of primary materials extracted from nature to support human activities. TMR is a highly aggregated indicator for the material basis of an economy. [definition source: EEA. 2000. Environmental signals 2000. Environmental assessment report No 6.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TMR.name: TMR

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.name: emission inventory
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.objectname_bg: указател на емисии в приложение към конвенцията за климата
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.objecttrans_bg: указател на емисии в приложение към Конвенцията за климата
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_emi.definition: A listing, by source, of the amount of air pollutants discharged into the atmosphere of a community. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_lv: ppbv, daļas uz miljardu - mazu koncentrāciju rādītājs (tilpuma vienībās)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_lt: santykinis skaičius pagal svorį milijardui vandens dalelių nustatytame tūryje
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_es: ppbv (partes por mil millones en volumen)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_es: ppbv (partes por mil millones en volumen)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.name: ppbv
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_lv: ppbv, daļas uz miljardu - mazu koncentrāciju rādītājs (tilpuma vienībās)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_lt: santykinis skaičius pagal svorį milijardui vandens dalelių nustatytame tūryje
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_cs: ppbv - jednotka pro měření částic v miliardě objemových částic
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_bg: ppbv - части от билион, по обем
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_bg: ppbv - части от билион, по обем
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.definition: A way to describe how much of a substance is contained in a sample: parts of analyte per billion parts of sample. In atmospheric chemistry this become volume parts of analyte per volume parts of atmosphere. [definition source: Sam Houston State University. United States. Atmospheric Chemistry Glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_cs: ppbv - jednotka pro měření částic v miliardě objemových částic

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_lt: santykinis skaičius pagal svorį milijardui vandens dalelių
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.name: ppb
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_lv: ppb, daļas uz miljardu - mazu koncentrāciju rādītājs (masas vienībās)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_lt: santykinis skaičius pagal svorį milijardui vandens dalelių
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objecttrans_cs: ppb - jednotka pro měření velmi malých koncentrací
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.definition: The number of 'parts' by weight of a substance per billion parts of water. Used to measure extremely small concentrations. [definition source: US Geological Survey. United States.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppb.objectname_cs: ppb - jednotka pro měření velmi malých koncentrací

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tot.definition: The quantity of fish that can be taken from each stock each year. In the European Union, the figure is agreed by the Fisheries Council of Ministers each December for the following year. EU Member States are allocated a fixed proportion of the total allowable catch as their national quota. [definition source: Countryside Council for Wales. 2001. A glossary on marine nature conservation and fisheries. United Kingdom.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tot.name: total allowable catch

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: native species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: Plants, animals, fungi, and micro-organisms that occur naturally in a given area or region. [definition source: Convention of Biological Diversity Secretariat. Belgian Clearing-House Mechanism.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_phy.definition: Microscopic plants that live in the surface layers of the seabed, particularly in shallow water and intertidal areas. [definition source: Countryside Council for Wales. 2001. A glossary on marine nature conservation and fisheries. United Kingdom.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_phy.name: phytobenthos

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_urb.name: urban agglomeration
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_urb.objectname_nl: stedelijk agglomeratie (geheel van stad, voorsteden en aangrenzend bebouwd gebied)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_urb.definition: Comprises a city or town proper and the suburban fringe or thickly settled territory lying outside, but adjacent to, its boundaries. A single large urban agglomeration may comprise several cities or towns and their suburban fringes. [definition source: United Nations. 1998. Principles and recommendations for population and housing censuses]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_urb.objecttrans_nl: stedelijk agglomeratie (geheel van stad, voorsteden en aangrenzend bebouwd gebied)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ESP.definition: Synonyms: European Spatial Planning Observation Network [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ESP.name: ESPON

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.definition: Removal of salt, as from water or soil. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.name: desalination

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Str.definition: Synonyms: SEBI [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Str.name: Streamlining European Biodiversity Indicators

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GMA.definition: Synonyms: Global Model of Ambient Particulates [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GMA.name: GMAPS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SPA.definition: Synonyms: special protection areas [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SPA.name: SPAs

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.definition: Synonyms: DTI [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.name: Department of Trade and Industry, United Kingdom
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.objecttrans_en: Department of Trade and Industry, United Kingdom
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.objectname_en: department of trade and industry, united kingdom

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.name: perfluorocarbon
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.definition: Family of industrial gases included in the basket of six greenhouse gases (GHGs) covered by the Kyoto Protocol. Although total emissions are relatively small, PFCs are extremely potent GHGs, with 100-year global warming potential of between 6 500 and 9 200. [definition source: European Commission. Climate change: Glossary of common terms and acronyms.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EPR.definition: The Environmental Policy Review Group (EPRG) has its origin in the fifth Community environmental action programme, 'Towards sustainability'. It is composed of representatives of the Commission, the Member States and the candidate countries at director-general level. Its mission is to develop a mutual understanding and exchange of views on environmental policies and measures. It is a dialogue group for getting Commission, Member States and candidate countries together to discuss on environmental issues at an early stage and not only at Council level on proposals; being a think tank where ideas on environmental issues can be explored or tested, prior to administrative and legislative developments, in the light of Member States ground reality. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EPR.name: EPRG

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_NMV.name: NMVOC
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_NMV.definition: Non-methane volatile organic compounds (NMVOCs) which include such compounds as propane, butane, and ethane are emitted primarily from transportation, industrial processes, and non-industrial consumption of organic solvents. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IMO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Maritime Organisation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.definition: Valuation technique which asks people directly how much they are willing to pay/to accept for improving/deteriorating environmental quality. [definition source: European Conference of Ministers of Transport. Social cost glossary. CEMT/CS(97)12.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.name: contingent valuation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pan.definition: Synonyms: PEEN [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pan.name: Pan-European Ecological Network

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.definition: Discharge of pollutants into the atmosphere from stationary sources such as smokestacks, and other vents, and from surface areas of commercial or industrial facilities and mobile sources, for example, motor vehicles, locomotives and aircrafts. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.name: air emission

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.objectname_tr: birleşmiş milletler iklim değişikliği çerçeve sözleşmesi
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.definition: The convention was adopted on 9 May 1992, in New York, and signed at the 1992 Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro by more than 150 countries and the European Community. Its ultimate objective is the 'stabilisation of greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere at a level that would prevent dangerous anthropogenic interference with the climate system'. It contains commitments for all parties. Under the convention, parties included in annex I aim to return greenhouse gas emissions not controlled by the Montreal Protocol to 1990 levels by the year 2000. The convention entered in force in March 1994. [definition source: IPCC. Climate change 2001 impacts, adaptation and vulnerability.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.objecttrans_tr: Birleşmiş Milletler İklim Değişikliği Çerçeve Sözleşmesi
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.name: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.objecttrans_en: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.objectname_en: united nations framework convention on climate change

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.objectname_sl: ločevanje in obdelava odpednega materiala z namenom prodaje
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.name: material recovery
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.objecttrans_sl: ločevanje in obdelava odpednega materiala z namenom prodaje
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mat.definition: Restoration of materials found in the waste stream to a beneficial use which may be for purposes other than the original use. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tol.definition: Estimate of the amount of a substance that can be ingested or absorbed over a specified period of time without appreciable health risk. [definition source: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. Risk assessment terminology. Chemistry International Vol. 23, No. 2. March 2001. John H. Duffus.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tol.name: tolerable daily intake

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.definition: The act or state of being subjected to energy flows strong enough to ionize atoms thereby posing a threat to human health or the environment. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rad.name: radiation exposure

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lar.definition: Directive 2001/80/EC on the limitation of emissions of certain pollutants into the air from large combustion plants. [definition source: Directive 2001/80/EC of 23 October 2001 on the limitation of emissions of certain pollutants into the air from large combustion plants.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lar.name: Large Combustion Plant Directive

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_art.name: artificial recharge (of groundwater)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_art.definition: Introduction of surface water into an underground aquifer through recharge wells. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_flo.definition: An unusual accumulation of water above the ground caused by high tide, heavy rain, melting snow or rapid runoff from paved areas. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_flo.name: flood

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Env.objectname_bg: програма за околната среда за европа
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Env.objecttrans_bg: Програма за околната среда за Европа
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Env.definition: The first all-European conference of environment ministers, attended by ministers from all the European countries (including the then Soviet Union) and the European Commission's Environment Commissioner, issued a call for a new environmental programme for Europe: a framework for the better coordination of national and international environmental efforts, setting priorities for restoring existing environmental damage and the prevention of future problems. That was under the auspicies of the United Nations Commission for Europe (UNECE). [definition source: EEA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Med.definition: The Mediterranean action plan (MAP) and the Barcelona Convention are being implemented through a series of protocols and the programmes are being carried out by relevant MAP regional activity centres. Among these programmes is the long-term programme for pollution monitoring and research in the Mediterranean (Medpol), designed to assess the extent of marine pollution in the Mediterranean. [definition source: Adapted from: UNEP.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Med.objectname_cs: program monitorování a výzkumu znečišťování středozemní oblasti)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mor.definition: The death rate; the ratio of the number of deaths per year to a given population. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mor.name: mortality

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.definition: Effective sound output of the various sources of noise associated with aircraft operation, such as propeller and engine exhaust, jet noise, and sonic boom. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.name: aircraft noise

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sus.name: Sustainable Tourism - Eliminating Poverty

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.objecttrans_bg: ИДА Международна асоциация за развитие, в ЕС: ПРОГРАМА за обмяна на данни между администрациите
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Interchange of data between administrations (IDA) is the European Commission's programme for linking Member States' administrations with Community institutions. It supports sectoral networks with generic and interoperable services. [definition source: EEA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.definition: The system of pipes supplying water to communities and industries. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.name: water supply system

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.definition: Market-based instruments seek to address the market failure of 'environmental externalities' either by incorporating the external cost of production or consumption activities through taxes or charges on processes or products, or by creating property rights and facilitating the establishment of a proxy market for the use of environmental services. [definition source: EEA based on UNEP's definition.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.name: market-based instrument

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sew.definition: System of collectors, pipelines, conduits and pumps to conduct wastewater from the point of generation to the place of disposal or treatment. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sew.name: sewerage system

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_is: kostnaður af umhverfinu, kostnaður fyrir umhverfið
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_is: kostnaður af umhverfinu, kostnaður fyrir umhverfið
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental cost
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: разходи по околната среда (разходи, възникнали в резултат на нарушение на екологичната цялост)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: разходи по околната среда (разходи, възникнали в резултат на нарушение на екологичната цялост)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Expenses incurred as a result of some violation of ecological integrity either by an enterprise that implements a program to rectify the situation, or by society or the ecosystem as a whole when no person or enterprise is held liable. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CLC.definition: In 1985 the Corine programme was initiated in the European Union. Corine means 'coordination of information on the environment' and it was a prototype project working on many different environmental issues. The Corine databases and several of its programme have been taken over by the EEA. One of these is an inventory of land cover in 44 classes, and presented as a cartographic product, at a scale of 1:100 000. This database is operationally available for most areas of Europe. Original inventories, based on and interpreted from satellite imagery as well as ancillary information sources, are stored within national institutions. The European reference database is owned by GISCO, the European Commission geographical information system, which is a part of the European Statistic Agency, Eurostat. ETC/TE manages the Corine database (the production database) on behalf of EEA and delivers the updated database to GISCO every 12 months. [definition source: ETC/TE.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CLC.name: CLC

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_scr.definition: An air pollution device that uses a spray of water or reactant to reduce or remove pollution from air pollution sources. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_scr.name: scrubber

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_alg.name: algal bloom
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_alg.definition: Excessive and rapid growth of algae and other aquatic plants when they are stimulated to grow too quickly by pollution. It takes place when there are too many nutrients in the water and is aggravated when accompanied by a rise in temperature. Although the algae grow quickly they soon die because they have swallowed up all the water's nutrients. As they decompose they tend to rise to the surface and form a green slime. Algal blooms have increased because higher levels of nitrogen and phosphates from agricultural areas have leached from the fields into water courses. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.name: district heating
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.objectname_bg: централно отопление (топлофициране, топлофикация) на населено място
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.objecttrans_bg: централно отопление (топлофициране, топлофикация) на населено място
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dis.definition: The supply of heat, either in the form of steam or hot water, from a central source to a group of buildings. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CLE.definition: Synonyms: current legislation [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CLE.name: CLE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objecttrans_es: diversidad específica; diversidad de las especies

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.name: species diversity
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.definition: The number and variety of species found in a given area in a region. [definition source: UNEP. Glossary of biodiversity terms.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: ELOISE [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Land-Ocean Interaction Studies

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Synonyms: ETR [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental tax reform

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ex_.definition: Ex post evaluation of policies refers to backward-looking assessment of the effects of introduced policies of proposals. [definition source: EEA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ex_.name: ex post evaluation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_OSP.definition: Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic. It was opened for signature at the Ministerial Meeting of the Oslo and Paris Commissions in Paris on 22 September 1992. The convention entered into force on 25 March 1998. [definition source: OSPAR website.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_OSP.name: OSPAR Convention

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_her.definition: An animal that feeds on grass and other plants. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_her.name: herbivore

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.definition: Invertebrate animals that live in or on seabed habitats, including the intertidal zone. [definition source: Adapted from: Countryside Council for Wales. 2001. A glossary on marine nature conservation and fisheries. United Kingdom.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.name: zoobenthos

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.objectname_hu: {aircha} tartalomcsökkenés, kimosódás (eső által történő), kihullás (gravitáció hatására történő)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.name: deposition
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.objecttrans_hu: {AIRCHA} tartalomcsökkenés, kimosódás (eső által történő), kihullás (gravitáció hatására történő)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.objectname_nl: neer doen slaan, depositie (vannit de lucht)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.definition: The transfer of substances in air to surfaces, including soil, vegetation, surface water, or indoor surfaces, by dry or wet processes. (S. L. Brown) [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dep.objecttrans_nl: neer doen slaan, depositie (vannit de lucht)

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PHA.definition: Synonyms: EU Pre-accession assistance programme [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_PHA.name: PHARE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_USS.definition: Synonyms: Union of Soviet Socialist Republics [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_USS.name: USSR

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNI.definition: Synonyms: United Nations Children's Fund [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNI.name: UNICEF

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.name: tropical forest
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.definition: The natural and semi-natural tropical or subtropical forest ecosystems, whether primary or secondary, whether closed or open forests, in both dry and humid areas. The areas concerned are those found within the tropics and subtropics delimited by the 30th northern and southern parallels. [definition source: Council Regulation (EC) No 3062/95 of 20 December 1995 on operations to promote tropical forests (Article 2)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TOF.definition: Synonyms: tropospheric ozone forming potential [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TOF.name: TOF

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.definition: Synonyms: Federation of Nature and National Parks of Europe [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EUR.name: EUROPARC

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ADB.definition: Synonyms: Asian Development Bank [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ADB.name: ADB

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IAE.definition: Synonyms: International Atomic Energy Agency [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IAE.name: IAEA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UBA.definition: Synonyms: Federal Environment Agency (Austria and Germany) [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UBA.name: UBA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GFP.definition: The standard of farming which a reasonable farmer would follow in the region concerned. Usual good farming practices are compatible with the need to safeguard the environment and maintain the countryside, in particular by sustainable farming. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GFP.name: GFP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sol.definition: Discarded solid materials. Includes agricultural waste, mining waste, industrial waste and municipal waste. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sol.name: solid waste

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.definition: PCBs are mixtures of 209 different chemicals (cogeners) that come in various forms including oily liquids, solids and hard resins. PCBs are organochlorines that were manufactured until the mid-1980s, after which they were banned due to their toxicity and persistence. PCBs have been widely used as insulators in electrical equipment. They have also been used in the production of hydraulic fluids, lubricants, inks, adhesives and insecticides. They are still found in old electrical equipment and releases into the environment continue from landfills. PCBs are very persistent in the environment, taking years to degrade. They are fat-soluble and bioaccumulate in the tissues of animals. PCBs have become worldwide pollutants due to long-distance transport on air currents. Exposure to PCBs can permanently damage the nervous, reproductive and immune systems of the human body. PCBs are known carcinogens and have been linked with the development of various forms of cancer including skin and liver. In mammals, PCBs are passed via the placenta to developing young in the womb and via breast milk to newborn babies. The disposal of wastes containing PCBs is regulated by the Basel Convention. [definition source: UNEP-Balkans.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.name: polychlorinated biphenyl

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acu.definition: A contact between an agent and a target occurring over a short time, generally less than a day. [definition source: The international programme on chemical safety. 2001. Glossary on key exposure assessment terms.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acu.name: acute exposure

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_ter.definition: A chemical, ionising agent, or virus that cause birth defects in organisms. [definition source: Okanagan University College.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_ter.name: teratogen

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rur.definition: Area outside the limits of any incorporated or inincorporated city, town, village, or any other designated residential or commercial area such as a subdivision, a business or shopping center, or community development. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_rur.name: rural zone

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MAR.definition: The major accident reporting system (MARS) is used by both EU and OECD member countries to report industrial accidents in the MARS standard format and to exchange accidents information on this basis. It is a distributed information network, consisting of local databases on a MS-Windows platform in each Member State of the European Union and a central UNIX-based analysis system at the European Commission's Joint Research Centre in Ispra (MAHB) that allows complex text retrieval and pattern analysis. [definition source: Institute for the Protection and Security of the Citizen (EC Joint Research Center). Major Accident Hazards Bureau (MAHB).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MAR.name: MARS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: ground-level ozone
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.objectname_bg: озон, който се намира в близост до земната повърхност
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.objecttrans_bg: озон, който се намира в близост до земната повърхност
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: The ozone in the air near the Earth’s surface. Also known as ambient or tropospheric ozone. See also ozone, troposphere and ambient air. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.definition: Synonyms: DEFRA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.name: Department for Environment Food and Rural Affairs, United Kingdom
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.objecttrans_en: Department for Environment Food and Rural Affairs, United Kingdom
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dep.objectname_en: department for environment food and rural affairs, united kingdom

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ISS.definition: Synonyms: Central Public Health Institute, Italy [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ISS.name: ISS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_max.definition: Synonyms: MAC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_max.name: maximum allowable concentrations

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_Tec.definition: Synonyms: TEAP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_Tec.name: Technology and Economic Assessment Panel

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_alk.name: alkalinity
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_alk.definition: A measure of the capacity of water to neutralise acids. [definition source: IPCC. Climate change 2001: Impacts, adaptation and vulnerability.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mob.definition: Moving source of air pollution, such as an automobile. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mob.name: mobile source

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CRF.definition: Synonyms: common reporting format [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CRF.name: CRF

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_win.name: wind erosion
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_win.objectname_bg: ветрова ерозия, ерозия в резултат на въздействие на ветрове
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_win.objecttrans_bg: ветрова ерозия, ерозия в резултат на въздействие на ветрове
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_win.definition: The breakdown of solid rock into smaller particles and its removal by wind. It may occur on any soil whose surface is dry, unprotected by vegetation (to bind it at root level and shelter the surface) and consists of light particles. The mechanisms include straightforward picking up of dust and soil particles by the airflow and the dislodging or abrasion of surface material by the impact of particles already airborne. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_foo.name: food chain
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_foo.definition: Sequence of organisms each of which uses the next lower member of the sequence as a food source. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pre.definition: An ecotoxicological measure for multiple species systems. It can be defined as the concentration below which a specified percentage of species in an ecosystem are expected to be protected. [definition source: Adapted from: David W. Pennington. Extrapolating ecotoxicological measures from small data sets.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pre.name: predicted no-effect concentration

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_act.name: active ingredient
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_act.definition: In any pesticide product, the component that kills, or otherwise controls, target pests. Pesticides are regulated primarily on the basis of active ingredients. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_saf.name: safe disposal
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_saf.objectname_nl: veilige verwerking, het zich veilig ontdoen van
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_saf.objectname_bg: екологосъобразно (безопасно) обезвреждане, ликвидиране, премахване на отпадъци
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_saf.objecttrans_bg: екологосъобразно (безопасно) обезвреждане, ликвидиране, премахване на отпадъци
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_saf.objecttrans_nl: veilige verwerking, het zich veilig ontdoen van

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Ram.objectname_sk: ktorékoľvek zo zamokrených území, ktoré boli nominované do ramsarského zoznamu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Ram.objectname_hu: ramsari terület, nemzetközi jelentőségű vizes terület
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Ram.name: Ramsar site
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Ram.objecttrans_hu: Ramsari terület, Nemzetközi Jelentőségű Vizes Terület
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Ram.objecttrans_sk: ktorékoľvek zo zamokrených území, ktoré boli nominované do ramsarského zoznamu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Ram.definition: Wetlands designated by the contracting parties of the Ramsar Convention for inclusion in the list of wetlands of international importance because they meet one or more of the Ramsar criteria. [definition source: Adapted from: Ramsar Convention web site.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spa.definition: The systematic assessment of land and water potential, alternative patterns of land use and other physical, social and economic conditions, for the purpose of selecting and adopting land-use options which are most beneficial to land users without degrading the resources or the environment, together with the selection of measures most likely to encourage such land uses. Land-use planning may be at international, national, district (project, catchment) or local (village) levels. It includes participation by land users, planners and decision-makers and covers educational, legal, fiscal and financial measures. [definition source: FAO. 1993.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spa.name: spatial planning

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CRU.definition: Synonyms: Climatic Research Unit [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CRU.name: CRU

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.definition: The rational application of a combination of biological, biotechnical, chemical, cultural or plant-breeding measures whereby the use of chemical plant protection products is limited to the strict minimum necessary to maintain the pest population at levels below those causing economically unacceptable damage or loss. [definition source: Oskam, A.J., Vijftigschild, R.A.N., Graveland, C.1997. Additional EU policy instruments for plant protection products. Final report.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.name: integrated pest management

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bod.name: body of surface water
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bod.objectname_fi: erillinen pintavesialue, esim. joki tai järvi
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bod.objecttrans_fi: erillinen pintavesialue, esim. joki tai järvi
