glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bod.definition: A discrete and significant element of surface water such as a lake, reservoir, a stream, river or canal, part of a stream, river or canal, a transitional water or a stretch of coastal water. [definition source: Directive 2000/60/EC of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (Water Framework Directive).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Asi.definition: Synonyms: ADB [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Asi.name: Asian Development Bank

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_thr.name: threatened species
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_thr.definition: A species that is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in the immediate (critically endangered), near (endangered) or medium-term (vulnerable) future. [definition source: IUCN Red List Categories]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hex.definition: Synonyms: HCB [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hex.name: hexachlorobenzene

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ELI.definition: The European list of notified chemical substances (ELINCS) is an everexpanding list, following notification to competent authorities of the placing of a new substance on the market. [definition source: Adapted from: European Commission. 2001. White paper on strategy for a future chemical policy. COM(2001) 88 final. Brussels.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ELI.name: ELINCS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.name: performance indicator
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.definition: Performance indicators compare actual conditions with a specific set of reference conditions. They measure the 'distance(s)' between the current environmental situation and the desired situation (target): 'distance to target' assessment. [definition source: EEA. 1999. Environmental indicators: Typology and overview. Technical report No 25. Copenhagen.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.definition: Liquid that has seeped through solid waste in a landfill and has extracted soluble dissolved or suspended materials in the process. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.name: landfill leachate

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.name: pollution prevention
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.objectname_bg: предотвратяване на замърсяването на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.objecttrans_bg: предотвратяване на замърсяването на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pol.definition: The use of materials, processes, or practices to reduce, minimise, or eliminate the creation of pollutants or wastes. It includes practices that reduce the use of toxic or hazardous materials, energy, water, and/or other resources. [definition source: California Air Resources Board. Glossary of Air Pollution Terms.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_meg.definition: The component of the plankton that consists of very large organisms over 20 cm in size. [definition source: McGraw Hill. PAE virtual glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_meg.name: megaplankton

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lde.name: Lden
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_Lde.definition: Day-evening-night level. It is a descriptor of noise level based on energy equivalent noise level (Leq) over a whole day with a penalty of 10 dB(A) for night time noise (22.00-7.00) and an additional penalty of 5 dB(A) for evening noise (i.e. 19.00-23.00). [definition source: Adapted from: EEA. 2001. TERM 2001. Copenhagen]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.definition: Shallow pond, usually human-made, where sunlight, bacteria and oxygen interact to help purify wastewater. The term is synonymous with sewage oxidation pond and stabilisation pond. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sta.name: stabilisation pond

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.name: integrated environmental assessment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.objecttrans_cs: jednotné posouzení z hlediska životního prostředí
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.definition: The interdisciplinary and social process, linking knowledge and action in public policy/decision contexts, and aimed at identification, analysis and appraisal of all relevant natural and human processes and their interactions which determine both the current and future state of environmental quality, and resources, on appropriate spatial and temporal scales, thus facilitating the framing and implementation of policies and strategies. [definition source: Adapted from: EEA. 1999. Environment in the European Union at the turn of the century. Page 14. Environmental assessment report No 2]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_int.objectname_cs: jednotné posouzení z hlediska životního prostředí

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.name: end-of-life vehicle
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.objectname_bg: стара кола, кола на старо, употребявана кола
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.objecttrans_bg: стара кола, кола на старо, употребявана кола
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_end.definition: 'End-of life vehicle' means a vehicle which is waste within the meaning of Article 1(a) of Directive 75/442/EEC on waste (waste means any substance or object which the holder disposes of or is required to dispose of pursuant to the provisions of national law in force). [definition source: Directive 2000/53/EC of 18 September 2000 on end-of life vehicles.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fal.definition: Arable land not under rotation that is set at rest for a period of time ranging from one to five years before it is cultivated again, or land usually under permanent crops, meadows or pastures, which is not being used for that purpose for a period of at least one year. Arable land which is normally used for the cultivation of temporary crops but which is temporarily used for grazing is included. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fal.name: fallow land

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: An interruption, cessation or disorder of human bodily functions, systems or organs resulting from genetic or developmental errors, infection, nutritional deficiency,toxicity, illness or unfavorable environmental factors. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmentally related disease

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IUCN [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Union for Nature Conservation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SD.definition: Synonyms: sustainable development [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SD.name: SD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dom.definition: Synonyms: DMC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dom.name: domestic material consumption

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SI.definition: Synonyms: sufficiency index [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SI.name: SI

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.objectname_tr: hava kirliliäinin ormanlar ãŧzerindeki etkilerinin deäerlendirilmesi ve izlenmesi hakkäąnda iåbirliäi programäą
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.definition: The cooperative programme on assessment and monitoring of air pollution effects on forest (ICP forests) was launched in 1985 under the Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution of the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE). [definition source: ICP forests web site.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.objecttrans_tr: hava kirliliÄinin ormanlar Ãŧzerindeki etkilerinin deÄerlendirilmesi ve izlenmesi hakkÄąnda iÅbirliÄi programÄą
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.name: cooperative programme on assessment and monitoring of air pollution effects on forest
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.objecttrans_en: cooperative programme on assessment and monitoring of air pollution effects on forest
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.objectname_en: cooperative programme on assessment and monitoring of air pollution effects on forest

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.name: bioenergy
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bio.definition: Biomass used in the production of energy. [definition source: National Biobased Products and Bioenergy Coordination Office, US Department of Energy. Biomass research and development initiative,]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.definition: The act, process or industry of extracting coal, ores, etc. from the earth. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_min.name: mining

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental headline indicator
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: основен индикатор за опазване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: основен индикатор за опазване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: An indicator in a very limited set of indicators (maximum 10), selected by policy-makers with the advice of information providers. The purpose of environmental headline indicators is to provide simple and clear information to decision-makers and the general public about progress in environmental policies and the key factors determining the state of the environment and whether we are moving towards environmental sustainability. The indicators should be designed to reach the headlines of newspapers. [definition source: EEA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tid.name: tidal marsh
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tid.definition: Low, flat marshland traversed by channels and tidal hollows and subject to tidal inundation. Normally, the only vegetation present are salt-tolerant bushes and grasses. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lit.definition: The solid inorganic portion of the earth (composed of rocks, minerals and elements). It can be regarded as the outer surface and interior of the solid earth. [definition source: Okanagan University College.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lit.name: lithosphere

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sta.definition: Synonyms: SOE [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sta.name: State of Environment

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_abs.name: absorption
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_abs.definition: The uptake of water, other fluids, or dissolved chemicals by a cell or an organism (as tree roots absorb dissolved nutrients in soil). [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_ter.name: tertiary treatment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_ter.definition: The process which remove pollutants not adequately removed by secondary treatment, particularly nitrogen and phosphorus; accomplished by means of sand filters, microstraining, or other methods (referring to wastewater treatment). Similar to advanced waste water treatment. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.definition: A period of continuous contact between an agent and a target. [definition source: The international programme on chemical safety. 2001. Glossary on key exposure assessment terms.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.name: exposure interval

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sof.definition: Synonyms: FISHSTAT [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sof.name: software for fishery statistics

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: A feature or component of the natural environment that is of value in serving human needs, e.g. soil, water, plantlife, wildlife, etc. Some natural resources have an economic value (e.g. timber) while others have a 'noneconomic' value (e.g. scenic beauty). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural resources

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Air.definition: Directive 96/62/EC on ambient air quality assessment and management. It provides a framework for setting in daughter-directives limit values for a range of pollutants, for assessing their concentrations and for managing air quality to avoid and prevent any exceedances of these limit values. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Air.name: Air Quality Framework Directive

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.definition: Synonyms: NATO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_Nor.name: North Atlantic Treaty Organization

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.definition: Establishment of a qualitative or quantitative relationship between risks and benefits, involving the complex process of determining the significance of the identified hazards and estimated risks to those organisms or people concerned with or affected by them. It is the first step in risk management. [definition source: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. Risk assessment terminology. Chemistry International Vol. 23, No. 2. March 2001. John H. Duffus.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.name: risk evaluation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.definition: Synonyms: TOF [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tro.name: tropospheric ozone forming potential

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.definition: Synonyms: UNDP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_Uni.name: United Nations Development Programme

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dra.name: drainage basin
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dra.definition: The area of land that drains water, sediment and dissolved materials to a common outlet at some point along a stream channel. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ope.objectname_hu: beépítetlen terület, vegetáció nélküli vagy gyenge vegetációjú terület
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ope.name: open land
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ope.objecttrans_hu: beépítetlen terület, vegetáció nélküli vagy gyenge vegetációjú terület
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_ope.definition: Non-built-up land with no, or with insignificant, vegetation cover. [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sem.definition: A stand which is composed predominantly of native trees and shrub species which have not been planted. Also, a forest which has developed gradually or accidentally, as its location or site quality was not suited for intensive exploitation or production-oriented management (e.g. in mountainous regions). This kind of reconstruction of the natural forest cover can be or has been achieved by using various silvicultural practices, e.g., natural regeneration or selective thinning and in some cases also planting. [definition source: Definition used in the Helsinki Process. Quoted by: FAO.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Sem.name: Semi-natural forest

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CAP.definition: Synonyms: Capacity Building for Air Quality Management and the Application of Clean Coal Combustion Technologies in Central Asia [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CAP.name: CAPACT

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nuc.definition: Device which creates heat and energy by starting and controlling atomic fission. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nuc.name: nuclear reactor

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GME.definition: Synonyms: global monitoring for environment and security [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_GME.name: GMES

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_V_vol.definition: Organic chemical compounds that under normal conditions are gaseous or can vaporise and enter the atmosphere. VOCs include such compounds as methane, benzene, xylene, propane and butane. Methane is primarily emitted from agriculture (from ruminants and cultivation), whereas non-methane VOCs (or NMVOCs) are mainly emitted from transportation, industrial processes and use of organic solvents. See also NMVOC. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_V_vol.name: volatile organic compounds

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.name: cooling water
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_coo.definition: Water which is used to absorb and remove heat. In the joint questionnaire cooling water is broken down into water used in the generation of electricity in power stations, and cooling water used in other industrial processes. [definition source: Eurostat/OECD Joint Questionnaire on Environmental Statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.definition: Establishment of a qualitative or quantitative relationship between risks and benefits, involving the complex process of determining the significance of the identified hazards and estimated risks to those organisms or people concerned with or affected by them. It is the first step in risk management. [definition source: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. Risk assessment terminology. Chemistry International Vol. 23, No. 2. March 2001. John H. Duffus.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_ris.name: risk-benefit evaluation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.definition: Synonyms: CLRTAP [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.name: Convention on Long-range Transboundary Air Pollution
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.objecttrans_en: Convention on Long-range Transboundary Air Pollution
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.objectname_en: convention on long-range transboundary air pollution

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_uti.name: utilised agriculture area
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_uti.objectname_bg: ползваема селскостопанска площ, обработена селскостопанска земя
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_uti.objecttrans_bg: ползваема селскостопанска площ, обработена селскостопанска земя
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_uti.definition: All the area of arable land, permanent meadow and pasture, and land developed to permanent crops and kitchen gardens. [definition source: Eurostat/Ministère de l'Agriculture e de la Pêche. Agriculture in the European Union. Éditions Agreste. France.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Med.definition: Synonyms: MIO-ECSDE [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Med.name: Mediterranean Information Office for Environment, Culture and Sustainable Development
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Med.objecttrans_en: Mediterranean Information Office for Environment, Culture and Sustainable Development
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Med.objectname_en: mediterranean information office for environment, culture and sustainable development

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Asi.definition: Synonyms: ASEF [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_Asi.name: Asia-Europe Foundation

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ENH.definition: Synonyms: environment and health information system [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ENH.name: ENHIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_agr.definition: The sum of area under arable land, permanent crops and permanent pastures. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_agr.name: agricultural land

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EEA.definition: The European Environment Agency (EEA) was established by Regulation (EEC) No 1210/1990, amended by Regulation (EEC) No 933/1990, and has been operational since 1994. The EEA aims to support sustainable development and to help achieve significant and measurable improvement in Europe's environment through the provision of timely, targeted, relevant and reliable information to policy-making agents and the public. The Agency processes data from the member countries to knowledge at European level, and cooperates with the European environment information and observation network (Eionet) and other international partners to gather, process and distribute data and information. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EEA.name: EEA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CBD.definition: Synonyms: Convention on Biological Diversity [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_CBD.name: CBD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tot.definition: Synonyms: TPES [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tot.name: total primary energy supply

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objectname_lv: spa, īpaša savvaļas putnu aizsardzības teritorija, kas noteikta saskaņā ar es savvaļas putnu aizsardzības direktīvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.name: special protection area
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objecttrans_lv: SPA, īpaša savvaļas putnu aizsardzības teritorija, kas noteikta saskaņā ar ES Savvaļas putnu aizsardzības direktīvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.definition: Area classified under Article 4 of the birds directive (Council Directive 79/409/EEC of 2 April 1979 on the conservation of wild birds). [definition source: Directive 79/409/EEC of 2 April 1979 on the conservation of wild birds.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.name: natural hazard
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_nat.definition: The probability of occurrence, within a specific period of time in a given area of a potentially damaging phenomenon of nature. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_NOA.definition: Greatest concentration or amount of a substance, found by observation or experiment, which causes no detectable adverse effect. Effects may be detected at this level, which are not judged to be adverse. [definition source: WHO. 1994. Assessing human health risks of chemicals: Derivation of guidance values for health-based exposure limits. Environmental health criteria 170. World Health Organization, Geneva.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_NOA.name: NOAEL

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_roa.definition: A road vehicle fitted with an engine whence it derives its sole means of propulsion, which is normally used for carrying persons or goods or for drawing, on the road, vehicles used for the carriage of persons or goods. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_roa.name: road motor vehicle

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.name: persistence
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.definition: The capacity of a substance to remain chemically stable. This is an important factor in estimating the environmental effects of substances discharged into the environment. Certain toxic substances (e.g. cyanides) have a low persistence, whereas other less immediately toxic substances (e.g. many organochlorines) have a high persistence and may therefore produce more serious effects. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_met.definition: A compound derived from the metabolism of another compound is said to be a metabolite of that compound. [definition source: Oregon State University (US).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_met.name: metabolite

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.definition: The purpose of Directive 2002/95/EC on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment is to approximate the laws of the Member States on the restrictions of the use of hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment and to contribute to the protection of human health and the environmentally sound recovery and disposal of waste electrical and electronic equipment. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.name: Directive 2002/95/EC on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.objecttrans_en: Directive 2002/95/EC on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_Dir.objectname_en: directive 2002/95/ec on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eff.name: efficiency indicator
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eff.definition: Indicators that relate environmental pressures to human activities. These indicators provide insight in the efficiency of products and processes: Efficiency in terms of the resources used, the emissions and waste generated per unit of output. [definition source: Adapted from: EEA. 1999. Environmental indicators: Typology and overview. Technical report No 25.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.name: descriptive indicator
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_des.definition: Descriptive indicators show the development of a variable, but are not connected with a concrete policy target. [definition source: EEA. 2000. Environmental signals 2000. Environmental assessment report No 6.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_war.definition: Dissemination of message signalling imminent hazard, which may include advice on protective measures. [definition source: United Nations. Internationally agreed glossary of basic terms related to disaster management.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_war.name: warning

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pro.definition: Synonyms: PEEREA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pro.name: Protocol on Energy Efficiency and Related Environmental Aspects
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pro.objecttrans_en: Protocol on Energy Efficiency and Related Environmental Aspects
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pro.objectname_en: protocol on energy efficiency and related environmental aspects

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Fed.definition: Synonyms: EUROPARC [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Fed.name: Federation of Nature and National Parks of Europe
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Fed.objecttrans_en: Federation of Nature and National Parks of Europe
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_Fed.objectname_en: federation of nature and national parks of europe

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ASC.definition: Agreement concluded in 1991, under the auspices of the Bonn Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals (UNEP/CMS) to coordinate and implement conservation measures for dolphins, porpoises and other toothed whales in the Baltic and North Seas. Currently (year 2002) eight European countries - Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden and the United Kingdom - are parties to the agreement. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_ASC.name: ASCOBANS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TV.definition: Synonyms: target value [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TV.name: TV

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TT.definition: travel & tourism [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TT.name: T&T

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hyd.definition: Synonyms: HFCs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_H_hyd.name: hydrofluorocarbons

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.definition: Synonyms: API [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_air.name: air pollution index

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental subsidy
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_cs: peněžitá pomoc zaměřená na životní prostředí, subvence
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: субсидия във връзка с околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: субсидия във връзка с околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: Payment by a government to assist or improve performance regarding ecological maintenance or the protection, defense, or shelter of natural resources. [definition source: GEMET 2000]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_cs: peněžitá pomoc zaměřená na životní prostředí, subvence

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cor.objectname_hu: {tra} művelés alól kivett terület, tartalék terület (állami tulajdondan lévő) 1); {natbio} sáv, menedék sáv, vadsáv, mezővédő erdősáv, élősövény, gyepsáv, sorközfű 2)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cor.objecttrans_is: gangur, svæði sem farið er um til að komast annað
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cor.objectname_is: gangur, svæði sem farið er um til að komast annað
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cor.name: corridor
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cor.objecttrans_hu: {TRA} művelés alól kivett terület, tartalék terület (állami tulajdondan lévő) 1); {NATBIO} sáv, menedék sáv, vadsáv, mezővédő erdősáv, élősövény, gyepsáv, sorközfű 2)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cor.definition: (1) A linear strip of land identified for present or future location of transportation or utility rights-of-way within its boundaries. (2) A thin strip of vegetation used by wildlife and potentially allowing movement of biotic factors between two areas. [definition source: Conservation Management Institute. United States.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.name: land clearing
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objectname_bg: саниране, прочистване на почвата от източници на стари отпадъци, прочистване на изостанали, неизползвани земи в смисъл на разораване
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.objecttrans_bg: саниране, прочистване на почвата от източници на стари отпадъци, прочистване на изостанали, неизползвани земи в смисъл на разораване
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.definition: Removal of trees, undergrowth, etc. in preparation for ploughing, building, etc. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.name: construction and demolition waste
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_fr: déchets de construction et de démolition
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_bg: отпадъци при строеж и разрушаване на сгради, строителни отпадъци
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objectname_ro: deşeuri de construcţie şi de demolare
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objecttrans_fr: déchets de construction et de démolition
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objecttrans_bg: отпадъци при строеж и разрушаване на сгради, строителни отпадъци
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.definition: Rubble and other waste material arising from the construction, demolition, renovation or reconstruction of buildings or parts thereof, whether on the surface or underground. Consists mainly of building material and soil, including excavated soil. Includes waste from all origins and from all economic activity sectors. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.objecttrans_ro: Deşeuri de construcţie şi de demolare

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppm.definition: A way to describe how much of a substance is contained in a sample: parts of analyte per million parts of sample. In atmospheric chemistry this becomes volume parts of analyte per volume parts of atmosphere. [definition source: Sam Houston State University. United States. Atmospheric Chemistry Glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_ppm.name: ppmv

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cos.name: cost-effectiveness analysis
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cos.definition: Least expensive way of achieving a given environmental quality target, or the way of achieving the greatest improvement in some environmental target for a given expenditure of resources. [definition source: The Cost Benefit Group & Damage Valuation Associates. Environmental Economics Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: IAEA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Atomic Energy Agency

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.objecttrans_es: situación ecológica de los ecosistemas marinos
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.objectname_es: situación ecológica de los ecosistemas marinos
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.name: ecological status of aquatic ecosystems
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_eco.definition: It is an expression of the quality of the structure and functioning of aquatic ecosystems associated with surface waters, classified in accordance with Annex V of the water framework directive. [definition source: Directive 2000/60/EC of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (Water Framework Directive).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.objectname_sl: bolezen, ki se prenaa z vodo
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.objecttrans_es: enfermedades que se transmiten por el agua
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.objectname_es: enfermedades que se transmiten por el agua
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.name: waterborne disease
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.objecttrans_sl: bolezen, ki se prenaa z vodo
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.objectname_bg: заболявания, дължащи се на замърсени води
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.objecttrans_bg: заболявания, дължащи се на замърсени води
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wat.definition: Disease that arises from infected water and is transmitted when the water is used for drinking or cooking (for example, cholera or typhoid). [definition source: United Nations. Glossary of environment statistics.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNE.definition: Synonyms: United Nations Economic Commission for Europe [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_U_UNE.name: UNECE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gre.definition: Modification of agriculture starting in the 1950s through the use of machines, fertiliser, pesticides, irrigation and the growth of hybrid varieties of rice, wheat, and corn. [definition source: Okanagan University College.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gre.name: green revolution

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IHP.definition: Synonyms: International HCH and Pesticides Association [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_IHP.name: IHPA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pol.definition: Synonyms: MED POL [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pol.name: Pollution Monitoring and Assessment Programme - Mediterranean Region
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pol.objecttrans_en: Pollution Monitoring and Assessment Programme - Mediterranean Region
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_Pol.objectname_en: pollution monitoring and assessment programme - mediterranean region

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.definition: Coordination of information on the environment. A programme proposed in 1985 by the European Commission, aimed at gathering information relating to the environment on certain priority topics for the European Union (land cover, coastal erosion, biotopes, etc.). [definition source: European Commission.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.name: Coordination of Information on the Environment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.objecttrans_en: Coordination of Information on the Environment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Coo.objectname_en: coordination of information on the environment

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.definition: Synonyms: WMO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.name: World Meteorological Organization

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sal.name: saline water
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sal.definition: Water with a salt concentration greater than 18 ppt. [definition source: Council Directive 75/440/EEC of 25 July 1975 concerning the quality required of surface water intended for the abstraction of drinking water in the Member States]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_low.definition: Lowest concentration or amount of a substance, found by observation or experiment, which causes an effect. [definition source: WHO. 1999. Air quality guidelines. Geneva.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_low.name: lowest-observed-effect level

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Che.definition: An accident at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant (Ukraine) on April 26th, 1986 to be assigned a index 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES). The explosion exposed the reactor core and released radioactive fission and neutron activation products, including transuranics from the reactore to the atmosphere. More than 140 000 km2 of the territory of Ukraine, Belarus and the Russian Federation, and more than 45 000 km2 of other European countries were contaminated with 137Cs over 40 kBq/m2. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Che.name: Chernobyl event

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_ng.definition: Synonyms: nanogram [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_ng.name: ng

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fos.name: fossil fuel
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fos.definition: Coal, natural gas and petroleum products (such as oil) formed from the decayed bodies of animals and plants that died millions of years ago. [definition source: World Bank. 2000. Beyond Economic Growth. Washington. At:]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objectname_lv: sci, kopienai nozīmīga teritorija, kas noteikta saskaņā ar es dzīvotnes direktīvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objectname_pl: obszar ważki z punktu widzenia ue
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.name: site of Community importance
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objecttrans_pl: obszar ważki z punktu widzenia UE
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objecttrans_lv: SCI, Kopienai nozīmīga teritorija, kas noteikta saskaņā ar ES Dzīvotnes direktīvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objecttrans_cs: místo důležité z hlediska Evropské komise
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objectname_bg: област от екологично значение за общността
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objecttrans_bg: област от екологично значение за Общността
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.definition: Site of Community importance means a site which, in the biogeographical region or regions to which it belongs, contributes significantly to the maintenance or restoration at a favourable conservation status of a natural habitat type in Annex I or of a species in Annex II and may also contribute significantly to the coherence of Natura 2000 referred to in Article 3, and/or contributes significantly to the maintenance of biological diversity within the biogeographic region or regions concerned. For animal species ranging over wide areas, sites of Community importance shall correspond to the places within the natural range of such species which present the physical or biological factors essential to their life and reproduction. [definition source: Directive 92/43/EEC of 21 May 1992 on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora (art 1 k).]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sit.objectname_cs: místo důležité z hlediska evropské komise

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cen.definition: The Central Data Repository is part of the ReportNet architechture. The Central Data Repository is like a bookshelf, with data reports on the environment as submitted to international clients. Each country either has a collection () for its deliveries or a referral () to a different preferred repository. The data reports within each country collection are arranged under the relevant reporting obligations or agreements [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_cen.name: central data repository

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EW-.definition: Synonyms: economy-wide material flow accounting [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EW-.name: EW-MFA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental economics
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: икономика на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: икономика на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: A recognized field of specialization in the discipline of Economics that embraces the issues of pollution control and environment protection, in which costs and benefits are difficult or impossible to estimate, much of the subject matter falling outside the competitive market system. Yet, it is an area in which immense common property resources need to be allocated sensibly to the overall public good. The subject is also very much concerned with ways and means to achieve this sensible allocation such as emission and effluent charges, user charges for the treatment or disposal of waste, environmental taxes, product charges, deposit refunds, tradeable pollution rights, performance bonds, natural resource accounting, and the economic implications of sustainable development. [definition source: GEMET 2000]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SDS.definition: Synonyms: safety data sheets [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_SDS.name: SDSs

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fun.definition: Chemicals used to kill or halt the development of fungi that cause plant disease, such as: storage rot; seedling diseases; root rots; vascular wilts; leaf blights, rusts, smuts and mildews, and viral diseases. These can be controlled by the early and continued application of selected fungicides that either kill the pathogens or restrict their development. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_F_fun.name: fungicide

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EBR.definition: Synonyms: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EBR.name: EBRD

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.objectname_lv: organisma kontakts ar ķīmisku, radioloģisku vai fizisku aģentu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.objecttrans_is: að verða fyrir, að verða fyrir áhrifum af e-u
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.objectname_is: að verða fyrir, að verða fyrir áhrifum af e-u
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.name: exposure
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.objecttrans_lv: organisma kontakts ar ķīmisku, radioloģisku vai fizisku aģentu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_exp.definition: Contact of an organism with a chemical, radiological, or physical agent. Exposure is quantified as the amount of the agent available at the exchange boundaries of the organism (e.g.; skin, lungs, gut) and available for absorption. [definition source: Oak Ridge National Laboratory. US Department of Energy.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.definition: Synonyms: WGMS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.name: World Glacier Monitoring Service

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_J_JI.definition: The Kyoto Protocol establishes this mechanism whereby Annex I Parties (listed in Annex B of the Kyoto Protocol) can receive emissions reduction units when it helps to finance projects that reduce net emissions in an Annex I Party country. [definition source: European Commission. 1999. Work programme for RTD actions in support of 'competitive and sustainable growth' 1998-2000.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_J_JI.name: JI

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pow.name: power generation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pow.objectname_bg: генериране на енергия, трансофрмиране на други форми на енергия в електрическа енергия
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pow.objecttrans_bg: генериране на енергия, трансофрмиране на други форми на енергия в електрическа енергия
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pow.definition: The act or process of transforming other forms of energy into electric energy. [definition source: ETC/CDS. General Environmental Multilingual Thesaurus (GEMET 2000)]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pas.definition: The conveyance of people over land, water or through air by automobile, bus, train, airplane or some other means of travel. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pas.name: passenger transport

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TSP.definition: Synonyms: total suspended particles [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_TSP.name: TSP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: A measure of the energy inputs to the economy, calculated by adding total domestic energy production plus energy imports minus energy exports, plus net withdrawals from existing stocks. [definition source: EEA. 2001. Renewable energies: success stories. Copenhagen.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: gross inland energy consumption

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sea.definition: Benthic community, usually on shallow, sandy or muddy bottoms of sea, dominated by grass-like marine plants. [definition source: IMO/UNESCO/WMO/WHO/IAEA/UN/UNEP. Joint Group of Experts of the Scientific Aspects of Marine Environmental Protection. Protecting the oceans from land-based activities.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sea.name: sea grass bed

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.definition: Synonyms: GHS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_glo.name: globally harmonized system

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bro.definition: Synonyms: BFRs [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bro.name: brominated flame retardants

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MOD.definition: Synonyms: Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_MOD.name: MODIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pro.name: product tax
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pro.definition: A product tax may be levied on the units of harmful substance contained in products: for instance, a carbon tax is based on the carbon content of each particular fossil fuel. The product tax may also be levied per unit of the product, if the objective is to reduce usage of the product generally. [definition source: OECD. 1996. Implementation strategies for environmental taxes. France.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mm.definition: Synonyms: millimetre [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mm.name: mm

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.objectname_lv: wta, gatavība pieņemt (kompensāciju par atteikšanos no preces vai pakalpojuma)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.name: willingness to accept
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.objecttrans_lv: WTA, gatavība pieņemt (kompensāciju par atteikšanos no preces vai pakalpojuma)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_wil.definition: The amount of compensation an individual is willing to take in exchange for giving up some good or service. This may be elicited from stated or revealed preference approaches. [definition source: UNEP. 1995. Global Biodiversity Assessment. Annex 6, Glossary. Quoted by: Convention of Biological Diversity Secretariat. Belgian Clearing-House Mechanism.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.name: land cover
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_L_lan.definition: Land cover corresponds to a (bio)physical description of the earth's surface. It is that which overlays or currently covers the ground. This description enables various biophysical categories to be distinguished - basically, areas of vegetation (trees, bushes, fields, lawns), bare soil, hard surfaces (rocks, buildings) and wet areas and bodies of water (watercourses, wetlands). [definition source: European Commission.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.objectname_sl: mehanizem za financiranje emisijsko varčnih projektov
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.objectname_da: clean development mechanism; mekanisme for bæredygtig udvikling
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.objecttrans_da: Clean Development Mechanism; mekanisme for bæredygtig udvikling
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.name: clean development mechanism
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.objecttrans_sl: mehanizem za financiranje emisijsko varčnih projektov
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.objectname_bg: механизъм за развитие на пречистването на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.objecttrans_bg: механизъм за развитие на пречистването на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Cle.definition: The Kyoto Protocol establishes the clean development mechanism (CDM) to enable Annex I Parties (listed in Annex B of the Kyoto Protocol) to finance emission-reduction projects in the countries of non-Annex I Parties. These Annex I Parties will receive certified emission reductions (CERs) for doing so. The goals of the CDM are: (1) to assist non-Annex I Parties in achieving sustainable development and in contributing to the ultimate objective of the convention and (2) to assist Annex I Parties in meeting their targets. [definition source: European Commission. 1999. Work programme for RTD actions in support of 'competitive and sustainable growth' 1998-2000.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_def.name: defensive expenditure
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_def.objectname_bg: разходи по опазване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_def.objecttrans_bg: разходи по опазване на околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_def.definition: This approach takes the cues from what people are observed to spend to protect themselves against a potential or a actual decline in their environmental quality. People buy goods and services, which help them to preserve the environment. [definition source: European Commission. 2000. Analysis of the fundamental concepts of resource management.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: Synonyms: EFTA [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European Free Trade Association

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.definition: The Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (MARPOL Convention) is the main international convention covering prevention of pollution of the marine environment by ships from operational or accidental causes. It is a combination of two treaties adopted in 1973 and 1978 respectively and updated by amendments through the years. [definition source: International Marine Organisation.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.name: Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.objecttrans_en: Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_Con.objectname_en: convention for the prevention of pollution from ships

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dan.name: dangerous chemicals
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_dan.definition: Chemicals classified by the EU and placed on Annex 1 to the Directive 67/548 of 27 June 1967 on the approximation of laws, regulations and administrative provisions relating to the classification, packaging and labelling of dangerous substances. [definition source: Adapted from: EEA. 1999. Environment in the European Union at the turn of the century. Environmental assessment report No 2]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pH.name: pH
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pH.definition: An expression of both acidity and alkalinity on a scale of 0 to 14, with 7 representing neutrality; numbers less than 7 indicate increasing acidity and numbers greater than 7 indicate increasing alkalinity. [definition source: Environment Canada. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.definition: Synonyms: WHO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_Wor.name: World Health Organization

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_BFR.definition: Synonyms: brominated flame retardants [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_BFR.name: BFRs

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_is: mat á (skyndilegum/miklum) áhrifum e-s á umhverfið
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_da: miljøindvirkningsvurdering; vurdering af effekten på miljøet
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_da: miljøindvirkningsvurdering; vurdering af effekten på miljøet
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_is: mat á (skyndilegum/miklum) áhrifum e-s á umhverfið
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.name: environmental impact assessment
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_nl: inschatting van de invloed op het milieu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objectname_bg: анализ на въздействието върху околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_bg: анализ на въздействието върху околната среда
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.definition: A technique used for identifying the environmental effects of development projects. As a result of Directive 85/337/EEC (as amended 1997), this is now a legislative procedure to be applied to the assessment of the environmental effects of certain public and private projects which are likely to have significant effects on the environment. An EIA requires a scoping study to be undertaken in order to focus the assessment. This can be carried out in the field or as a desk study depending on the nature/scale of the project. [definition source: European Commission. 1999. Integrating environment concerns into development and economic cooperation. Draft version 1.0. Brussels]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_env.objecttrans_nl: inschatting van de invloed op het milieu

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_el: ευρωπαϊκό σύστημα πληροφοριών για τη φύση
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_es: Sistema europeo de información sobre la naturaleza
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_pt: sistema europeu de informação sobre a natureza (eunis)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_es: sistema europeo de información sobre la naturaleza
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.name: European nature information system
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_el: ευρωπαϊκό σύστημα πληροφοριών για τη φύση
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_pt: Sistema Europeu de Informação sobre a Natureza (EUNIS)
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_fr: système d'information sur la nature de l'union européenne
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objectname_ro: sistem de informare cu privire la mediul natural european
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_fr: Système d'information sur la nature de l'Union européenne
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.definition: EUNIS has been developed by the EEA European Topic Centre on Nature Protection and Biodiversity. It has two main aims: to facilitate use of data by promoting harmonisation of terminology and definitions, and to be a reservoir of information on European environmentally important matters. EUNIS consists of a central unit integrating data models on species, habitats and sites; several secondary databases which are managed by different partners; and an increasing number of satellite databases. [definition source: Adapted from: ETC/NPB.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_Eur.objecttrans_ro: sistem de informare cu privire la mediul natural european

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sur.name: surface water
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sur.definition: All waters on the surface of the Earth found in rivers, streams, ponds, lakes, marshes, wetlands, as ice and snow, and transitional, coastal and marine waters. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tre.definition: The general direction in which something tends to move. A general tendency or inclination. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_T_tre.name: trend

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_Org.definition: Synonyms: OECD [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_Org.name: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_Org.objecttrans_en: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_O_Org.objectname_en: organization for economic co-operation and development

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_BeN.definition: Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_BeN.name: BeNeLux

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Str.definition: Synonyms: SAICM [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Str.name: Strategic Approach to International Chemicals Management
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Str.objecttrans_en: Strategic Approach to International Chemicals Management
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_Str.objectname_en: strategic approach to international chemicals management

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.objectname_hu: tengeri vízfelület, tengeri éghajlati terület, tengeri éghajlatú környezet
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.name: marine habitats
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.objecttrans_hu: tengeri vízfelület, tengeri éghajlati terület, tengeri éghajlatú környezet
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_mar.definition: One of the main habitat types in the EUNIS habitats classification. Marine habitats are directly connected to the oceans, i.e. part of the continuous body of water which covers the greater part of the earth surface and which surround its land masses. Marine waters may be fully saline, brackish or almost fresh. Marine habitats include those below spring high tide limit (or below mean water level in non-tidal waters) and enclosed coastal saline or brackish waters, without a permanent surface connection to the sea but either with intermittent surface or sub-surface connections (as in lagoons). Rock pools in the supralittoral zone are considered as enclaves of the marine zone. Includes marine littoral habitats which are subject to wet and dry periods on a tidal cycle including tidal saltmarshes; marine littoral habitats which are normally water-covered but intermittently exposed due to the action of wind or atmospheric pressure changes; freshly deposited marine strandlines characterised by marine invertebrates. Waterlogged littoral zones above the mean water level in non-tidal waters or above the spring high tide limit in tidal waters are included with marine habitats. Includes constructed marine saline habitats below water level as defined above (such as in marinas, harbours, etc.) which support a semi-natural community of both plants and animals. The marine water column includes bodies of ice. [definition source: Davies, C. E. and Moss, D. 1999. Quoted by: EUNIS. EUNIS habitats classification. Glossary.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acu.objectname_hu: {chehea} akut mérgezés, hirtelen fellépő mérgezés, heveny mérgezés
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acu.name: acute toxicity
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acu.objecttrans_hu: {CHEHEA} akut mérgezés, hirtelen fellépő mérgezés, heveny mérgezés
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_A_acu.definition: The ability of a substance to cause severe biological harm or death soon after a single exposure or dose. Also, any poisonous effect resulting from a single short-term exposure to a toxic substance. [definition source: US EPA.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_DG_.definition: Synonyms: Directorate General for Health and Consumer Protection [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_DG_.name: DG SANCO

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.definition: Annex IIA of Directive 91/156/EEC amending Directive 75/442/EEC on waste, is intended to list disposal operations such as they occur in practice:D1 Tipping above or underground (e.g. landfill, etc.) D2 Land treatment (e.g. biodegradation of liquid or sludge discards in soils, etc.) D3 Deep injection (e.g. injection of pumpable discards into wells, salt domes or naturally occuring repositories, etc.) D4 Surface impoundment (e.g. placement of liquid or sludge discards into pits, ponds or lagoons, etc.) D5 Specially engineered landfill (e.g. placement into lined discrete cells which are capped and isolated from one another and the environment, etc.) D6 Release of solid waste into a water body except seas/oceans D7 Release into seas/oceans including seabed insertion D8 Biological treatment not specified elsewhere in this Annex which results in final compounds or mixtures which are disposed of by means of any of the operations in this Annex D9 Physico-chemical treatment not specified elsewhere in this Annex which results in final compounds or mixtures which are disposed of by means of any of the operations in this Annex (e.g. evaporation, drying, calcination, etc.) D10 Incineration on land D11 Incineration at sea D12 Permanent storage (e.g. emplacement of containers in a mine, etc.) D13 Blending or mixture prior to submission to any of the operations in this Annex D14 Repackaging prior to submission to any of the operations in this Annex D15 Storage pending any of the operations in this Annex, excluding temporary storage, pending collection, on the site where it is produced. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_W_was.name: waste disposal operations

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_RCE.definition: Synonyms: Royal Commission on Environmental Pollution [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_RCE.name: RCEP

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ele.definition: A general term used for all phenomena caused by electric charge whether static or in motion. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ele.name: electricity

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_NIS.definition: Synonyms: Newly Independent States [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_NIS.name: NIS

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Min.definition: Synonyms: MIMAM [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_M_Min.name: Ministry of Environment of Spain

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.definition: Land used permanently (five years or more) for herbaceous forage crops, either cultivated or growing wild (wild prairie or grazing land). [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_per.name: permanent pasture

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EPA.definition: Synonyms: environmental protection agency [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EPA.name: EPA

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_der.definition: Adverse effects resulting from skin exposure to a substance. [definition source: University of Texas. MSDS glossary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_D_der.name: dermal toxicity

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EPE.definition: The first all-European conference of environment ministers, attended by ministers from all the European countries (including the then Soviet Union) and the European Commission's Environment Commissioner, issued a call for a new environmental programme for Europe: a framework for the better coordination of national and international environmental efforts, setting priorities for restoring existing environmental damage and the prevention of future problems. That was under the auspicies of the United Nations Commission for Europe (UNECE). [definition source: EEA.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_EPE.name: EPE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objectname_lv: izcelsmes princips, princips, kas paredz vides kaitējuma novēršanu tā izcelsmes vietā
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objecttrans_is: meginreglan um stöðvun vanda við rót sína
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objecttrans_it: principio della correzione del danno ambientale alla fonte
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objectname_da: princippet om indgreb over for miljøskader fortrinsvis ved kilden
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objecttrans_da: princippet om indgreb over for miljøskader fortrinsvis ved kilden

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.name: source principle
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objecttrans_lv: izcelsmes princips, princips, kas paredz vides kaitējuma novēršanu tā izcelsmes vietā
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objectname_fr: principe de la correction par la priorité à la source
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.objecttrans_fr: principe de la correction par la priorité à la source
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_sou.definition: The environmental damage should preferably be prevented at the source, rather than by using the 'end-of-pipe technology'. This principle also implies a preference for emission standards rather than environmental quality standards, especially to deal with water and air pollution. [definition source: Oskam, A.J., Vijftigschild, R.A.N., Graveland, C.1997. Additional EU policy instruments for plant protection products. Final report.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.definition: Synonyms: ISO [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_Int.name: International Organisation for Standardization

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.objecttrans_is: dýrasvif, svifdýr í sjó eða vatni
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.objectname_is: dýrasvif, svifdýr í sjó eða vatni
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.name: zooplankton
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_Z_zoo.definition: Microscopic animals that float freely in the open water. [definition source: EEA. 1994. European rivers and lakes. EEA Environmental Monographs 1.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bui.definition: Land under houses, roads, mines and quarries and any other facilities, including their auxiliary spaces, deliberately installed for the pursuit of human activities. Included area also certain types of open land (non-built-up land), which are closely related to these activities, such as waste tips, derelict land in built-up areas, junk yards, city parks and gardens, etc. Land occupied by scattered farm buildings, yards and their annexes are excluded. Land under closed villages or similar rural localities is included. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_B_bui.name: built-up land

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.definition: Quantity of a material or substance contained in unit quantity of a given medium or system. [definition source: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry. Risk assessment terminology. Chemistry International Vol. 23, No. 2. March 2001. John H. Duffus.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_C_con.name: concentration

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Reg.definition: Synonyms: RAINS [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Reg.name: Regional Air Pollution Information and Simulation model
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Reg.objecttrans_en: Regional Air Pollution Information and Simulation model
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_R_Reg.objectname_en: regional air pollution information and simulation model

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.definition: Organic chemical compounds, excluding methane, that under normal conditions can vaporise and enter the atmosphere. NMVOCs include such compounds as benzene, xylene, propane and butane. NMVOCs are mainly emitted from transportation, industrial processes and use of organic solvents. See also VOCs. [definition source: EEA Ozone web]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_N_non.name: non-methane volatile organic compound

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.name: groundwater recharge
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_G_gro.definition: The process by which external water is added to the zone of saturation of an aquifer, either directly into a formation or indirectly by way of another formation. [definition source: IPCC. Climate change 2001: Impacts, adaptation and vulnerability.]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objectname_lv: sac, īpaša dabas aizsardzības teritorija, kas noteikta saskaņā ar es dzīvotnes un savvaļas floras un faunas aizsardzības direktīvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.name: special area of conservation
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.objecttrans_lv: SAC, īpaša dabas aizsardzības teritorija, kas noteikta saskaņā ar ES Dzīvotnes un savvaļas floras un faunas aizsardzības direktīvu
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_S_spe.definition: Site designated according to the habitats directive. Special area of conservation means a site of Community importance designated by the Member States through a statutory, administrative and/or contractual act where the necessary conservation measures are applied for the maintenance or restoration, at a favourable conservation status, of the natural habitats and/or the populations of the species for which the site is designated. [definition source: Directive 92/43/EEC of 21 May 1992 on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora (art.1).]

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pri.definition: A message sent to customers in the form of a price charged for a commodity; usually indicates a message intended to produce a particular result. [definition source: EnergyVortex.com. Energy dictionary.]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_P_pri.name: price signal

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.definition: It technically supports EEA in the implementation of the soil monitoring and assessment framework through the keeping and further developing of databases and information for indicator development and reporting on soil and land issues, including the terrestrial aspects of coastal environment. [definition source: European Commission. 2001. The soil protection communication (draft October 2001). Brussels]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_E_ETC.name: ETC/TE

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ino.definition: Inorganic fertiliser means a fertiliser in which the declared nutrients are in the form of minerals obtained by extraction or by physical and/or chemical industrial processes. [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ino.name: inorganic fertiliser

glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ICC.definition: Synonyms: International Council of Chemical Associations [definition source: EEA multilingual environmental glossary]
glossary.eea.europa.eu_EEAGlossary_I_ICC.name: ICCA
